"""Great soundtrack;"""
"""The ""Wicked"" Original Broadway Cast recording sparkles with energy and emotion, and features the original performers for whom the music was specifically written.  The musical version of ""Wicked"" differs substantially from the original novel by Gregory Maguire but the altered storyline, in which the minor character of Glinda the Good in the novel is elevated to co-star status in the musical, becomes a story of the friendship between two young women and the sacrifices they must make to be true to their ideals.While this makes the musical story completely different than the book it is arguably more compelling than the actual novel, as evidenced by the show's runaway success on Broadway, Chicago and on national tour.  Add composer Stephen Schwartz's best work since ""Pippen"" 30 years ago and the result is a show that IMO is easily as enjoyable as ""Les Miserables"" and far more gripping than ""Phantom of the Opera"" or ""Miss Saigon.""Schwartz introduces the dramatic ""Wicked Witch"" theme (a six chord progression whose unspoken lyrics purportedly are ""oh no, the witch is here"") in the first moments of the overture and recalls it chillingly again moments later when it becomes apparent at the Wicked Witch's birth that something is horribly wrong.  Then, when the young Witch is finally united with her true love in the second act, the love theme utilizes the exact same chord progression, but now set in a compelling ostinato figure that underscores the urgency and desperation of their fleeting moment together.  The Hindemith-like antiphony of ""No One Mourns the Wicked"" both jars us and serves to clue us into realizing that something's not quite right during the ""Ding-Dong the Witch is Dead""-like opening celebration number.The hopeful yet tragic ""Unlimited"" theme arcs through the story and is a clever homage to the ""Wizard of Oz"" movie score, using the same first seven notes as ""Somewhere Over the Rainbow"" and then diverging.  Schwartz noted in interviews that he chose to use only the first seven notes as an inside joke because copyright laws specifically define eight notes as the point where infringement on someone else's tune occurs.The music of ""Wicked"" is for the most part completely dependent on the context of the musical and the individual numbers do not stand alone well, but Ms. Chenowith's ""Popular"" and Ms. Menzel's legitimate showstopper ""Defying Gravity"" are justifiably acclaimed, and the de facto finale ""For Good"" is already available on Amazon on two other non-Broadway recordings, one of which features the composer singing half of the duet himself.The aforementioned love song ""As Long as You're Mine"" also has to be heard in the context of the story to be fully appreciated; the audience at this point in the musical has been taken on a journey from the apparent celebration of the witch's demise at the beginning to the show 180 degrees to where we now understand her character and motivations to where from ""Defying Gravity"" onwards we are actually cheering for the witch to succeed; by the time this duet comes along near the end of the second act, the witch and her true love are being hunted across the land and we already know that our heroine is doomed to melt (and soon!) at the hands of a certain Kansas farmgirl, lending the lyrics and chord progressions, maudlin at best out of context, tremendous pathos and power akin to ""The Fall of Saigon"" and ""The Last Night of the World"" in ""Miss Saigon.""  Only when you see the musical do you understand why Schwartz chose Fiyero's otherwise jarring verse ""Maybe I'm brainless, maybe I'm wise.""""Wicked"" is well worth your time but you'll enjoy it infinitely more once you also see the show, and the show itself is well worth a weekend trip to the nearest city staging a production to see it.;"""
"""I haven't seen the show Wicked yet, bit I am aware that the show is currently playing in Chicago, at the Ford Center for the Performing Arts, Oriental Theatre, my family actually did have tickets to see this show, but we coudln't go the night that we had tickets for, and still haven't see it sinmce, so I don't know when I will see the show, even through I won't see the orginal cast, but it opened here, with the idea to keep it here as long as people liked it, and didn't get tired of it playing here, it actually opened wqith a different cast, that plated until mid June, which then had closed for 10 days, and opened with a Chicago cast. Kristin Chenoweth was apart of the orginal broadway cast, when it opened in New York, at the end of 2003, and they recored this cd and brought it. I bought a copy, but let me warn you that while the is 2 hours and 43 minutes, with a 15 minute intermission, the cd is 71 minutes long, but I also own a copy of Monty Python' Spamalot, and All Shook Up, and both are shorter then 60 mintues, so if you are in a hurry and want to hear the orginal broadway cast, those 2 cds will be better to listen to if you only have an hour to listneing to a broadway show. Stephen Oremus, who later did All Shook Up, that played in Chicago in Previews before oepnning offically in New York, is the Conductor and Director, but I think he is the musical director of the show, but I bet it would have been nice to see the broadway show with the orfinal cast, but it opened in New York, and that would be a far place to see the show. If you can spear 72 minutes of your life, then I urge you to take a listen to this show. But if you are in that much of a hurry then I reccoemend Spmalalot (if you also wanted to hear famous people's voices) or All Shook Up, Spamalot is almost 53 minutes long, and All Shook Up is almost 59 minutes long. But these are some good cds to listen to of the broadway cast, and that would be the orginal cast.;"""
"""I just saw this musical performance for the first time a little over a month ago.  Needless to say, I fell absolutely in love with it and bought this album the very next morning (getting the mp3 songs from Amazon instantly is awesome) and listened to it for a month straight without ever getting tired of it.  This is not something I normally do!The songs are a beautiful blend of fun, upbeat, lighthearted, and quirky - all very much reflective of the colorful, magical, and sometimes very strange and dark world of the Wizard of Oz on which it's based.  And yet there's such a surprising amount of emotional depth here too.  Every song recorded here manages to capture the irony, humor, heartbreak, loss, lies, and hope that are present in the actual performance.  And they're quite catchy too, lodging themselves in your head for days and weeks at a time.  Some of my favorites are ""Popular"", ""What is this Feeling?"" ""Dancing through Life"", ""Thank Goodness"", ""Defying Gravity"", and ""For Good"" (have I named them all yet??).Kristin Chenoweth and Idina Menzel are simply amazing here (as usual) and even better together!  Fortunately there are many songs for them to show off their defiant, loathing-laden, tear-jerking duets and harmonies and other musical terms I don't quite understand.At $7.00 right now for both the physical CD album and the mp3s, it's a steal worth stealing.  This was my very first Amazon purchase of 2017, and I don't regret it for a minute or a cent.;"""
"""I am a big fan of Gregory McQuires novels, 'Wicked' and 'Confessions Of An Ugly Step-Sister' being by far the best. The way he looks at the questions of good and evil is a recurring theme. No one truely thinks they are evil, just misunderstood. And 'Good' people (bible-waving happy clappers, et al) are equally questionable. In reality everyone thinks their actions are justfied and for the best.The news that 'Wicked' would be made into a musical floored me a little. I was eagerly awaiting the mega-bucks Hollwood adaptation that has been in the works for years with Demi Moore's production company. But a musical makes sense - Oz has always been a muscal world, and the medium it lends itself to colourful fantasy. Plus the characters can speak directly to the audience and tell us what they are thinking; hard to achieve in film.Being in Australia I knew it would be years before we got to see 'Wicked' on stage, so  ordered the cast recording from amazon. At first I wasn't a fan of the music. I thought it was a little too Disney, and once I discovered the composers credentials lay in 'Beauty And The Beast' and 'Poccahontas', I shuddered. Elphaba sounds more like Arial from 'The Little Mermaid' than the dark and deep creature created by McGuire. But credit to Stephen Schwartz, what seemed poppy and pretty on the surface soon turned out to have a very dark heart, which beautiflly reflects the themes. The songs get better and better on further listening, and the vocal performances are sensational, especially by Kristin Chenoweth (possibly the best name ever), who has a devilish sense of comic timing and manages the different faces of Glinda (sweet Valley Girl 'Clueless' to the operatic high As.) She is hilarious and a stand-out talent. She made this recording for me and I would hate to be another performer stepping into her role.Beautifully scored and performed, packed full of humour, and wth a story line that has been even further developed by the remarkable Winnie Holtzman, 'Wicked' is a fully realized and magical experience. Now if it would just head Down Under...;"""
"""WICKED is an outstanding new musical from the pen of Stephen Schwatz (PIPPIN, THE BAKER'S WIFE) based on the novel of the same name by Gregory Maguire.  This musical is probably the Great White Hope of the 2003-04 Broadway season.Maguire's novel recounts the early lives of Oz's Glinda (the Good Witch of the North) and Elphaba (the Wicked Witch of the West), long before Dorothy and her house dropped into the story.Kristin Chenoweth (STEEL PIER, ANNIE) and Idina Menzel (RENT) play, respectively, Glinda and Elphaba.The musical is told in flashback as Glinda recalls meeting Elphaba at Shiz University, where the two aspiring students became room-mates.  Elphaba is treated as an outcast because of her green skin, but soon shows much promise, and is groomed as the protege of the Wizard (Joel Grey - CABARET, CHICAGO).  Glinda becomes romantically involved with the handsome yet shallow Prince Fiyero (Norbert Leo Butz), though he soon begins to take a fancy to Elphaba's charms.  Elphaba's crippled sister  Nessarose (played by Michelle Federer)  who would become the Wicked Witch of the East  - the one Dorothy's house drops on -  also figures heavily in the action.  Carole Shelley also impresses with a masterful performance as the corrupt college dean Madame Morrible, with fine support from Christopher Fitzgerald (BABES IN ARMS) as Nessarose's munchkin companion Boq.Stephen Schwartz, with Winnie Holzman's libretto, streamlines Gregory Maguire's sprawling, complicated novel, with a charming and imaginative score.  Standout numbers include ""Popular"", ""I'm Not That Girl"", ""Defying Gravity"" and the effective opening number (which sums up the theme of the show) called ""No-one Mourns the Wicked"".A must-own!;"""
"""I do not understand (and want you to disregard) those reviews written by people who have experienced only either this CD or the show. Please find reviews who have watched the show AND listened this CD.I bought this CD after I purchase the musical ticket but before watching the show. I kind of prepared for the show (and that is what I do to understand the show performance better). My first impression for the CD is not the greatest - it is like 3 stars out of 5. It sounds more like.... very well singing amateurs rather than professionals. Notes and voices are not too stable making you lose focus to the music.Then I saw the show - well played and well made, very creative story. Now I see why people give this musical as good reviews as the 4 major musicals. The casts actually sang better than the CD casts and I thought the CD can be better if re-recorded. Here this CD earned one more star from me, because of the show.Then I listened the CD again - it brouhgt all the scenes and memories from the musical. I can picture the scenes by each song.I personally think all the mucial sound track CDs are for those who wants to keep the memories from the show after wathcing the show. I don't think the intention was to replace whole musical with this one set of CD so that you do not have to watch the show. It is like you buy a Harry Potter movie scripts instead of the novel book then say ""this book is horrible"".Conclusion: CD perfomance = 3 stars, CD with the memories from the show = 4 stars;"""
"""I haven't seen the Broadway show, so I can't say much about it.  I bought the CD because I am a big fan of the Gregory Maguire novel, and was intrigued by the very idea that a musical had been derived from it.  I'm glad I did; the CD is excellent, with more than a few standout numbers, including ""No One Mourns the Wicked,"" ""Dancing Through Life,"" ""Popular,"" ""Defying Gravity,"" and ""Wonderful.""The two leads, Idina Menzel and Kristin Chenoweth (playing the Wicked Witch Elphaba and Galinda the Good Witch), have beautiful singing voices, and also do a fantastic job of adding to the characterizations through their performances (for a good example of this, listen to the song ""What Is This Feeling?"", which is another of those standout numbers I mentioned a second ago).  Also excellent, not that this is a surprise, is Joel Grey, who plays the Wizard with tremendous charm and an undercurrent of dangerous mania.  The orchestra turns in a beautiful performance on this recording, as well.If you happen to be unfamiliar with the story of ""Wicked,"" it's a take-off on ""The Wizard of Oz"" in which we learn the origins and background of the Wicked Witch of the West.  It turns out she had a name, Elphaba, and that she didn't begin life as a villain.  In fact, it seems to be debatable as to whether she was ever a villain, or simply a victim of a fascist government and a gullible girl from Kansas.I highly recommend this CD.  Hopefully, someone will issue a DVD of the show so I can see it!;"""

"""Great soundtrack;"""
"""The ""Wicked"" Original Broadway Cast recording sparkles with energy and emotion, and features the original performers for whom the music was specifically written.  The musical version of ""Wicked"" differs substantially from the original novel by Gregory Maguire but the altered storyline, in which the minor character of Glinda the Good in the novel is elevated to co-star status in the musical, becomes a story of the friendship between two young women and the sacrifices they must make to be true to their ideals.While this makes the musical story completely different than the book it is arguably more compelling than the actual novel, as evidenced by the show's runaway success on Broadway, Chicago and on national tour.  Add composer Stephen Schwartz's best work since ""Pippen"" 30 years ago and the result is a show that IMO is easily as enjoyable as ""Les Miserables"" and far more gripping than ""Phantom of the Opera"" or ""Miss Saigon.""Schwartz introduces the dramatic ""Wicked Witch"" theme (a six chord progression whose unspoken lyrics purportedly are ""oh no, the witch is here"") in the first moments of the overture and recalls it chillingly again moments later when it becomes apparent at the Wicked Witch's birth that something is horribly wrong.  Then, when the young Witch is finally united with her true love in the second act, the love theme utilizes the exact same chord progression, but now set in a compelling ostinato figure that underscores the urgency and desperation of their fleeting moment together.  The Hindemith-like antiphony of ""No One Mourns the Wicked"" both jars us and serves to clue us into realizing that something's not quite right during the ""Ding-Dong the Witch is Dead""-like opening celebration number.The hopeful yet tragic ""Unlimited"" theme arcs through the story and is a clever homage to the ""Wizard of Oz"" movie score, using the same first seven notes as ""Somewhere Over the Rainbow"" and then diverging.  Schwartz noted in interviews that he chose to use only the first seven notes as an inside joke because copyright laws specifically define eight notes as the point where infringement on someone else's tune occurs.The music of ""Wicked"" is for the most part completely dependent on the context of the musical and the individual numbers do not stand alone well, but Ms. Chenowith's ""Popular"" and Ms. Menzel's legitimate showstopper ""Defying Gravity"" are justifiably acclaimed, and the de facto finale ""For Good"" is already available on Amazon on two other non-Broadway recordings, one of which features the composer singing half of the duet himself.The aforementioned love song ""As Long as You're Mine"" also has to be heard in the context of the story to be fully appreciated; the audience at this point in the musical has been taken on a journey from the apparent celebration of the witch's demise at the beginning to the show 180 degrees to where we now understand her character and motivations to where from ""Defying Gravity"" onwards we are actually cheering for the witch to succeed; by the time this duet comes along near the end of the second act, the witch and her true love are being hunted across the land and we already know that our heroine is doomed to melt (and soon!) at the hands of a certain Kansas farmgirl, lending the lyrics and chord progressions, maudlin at best out of context, tremendous pathos and power akin to ""The Fall of Saigon"" and ""The Last Night of the World"" in ""Miss Saigon.""  Only when you see the musical do you understand why Schwartz chose Fiyero's otherwise jarring verse ""Maybe I'm brainless, maybe I'm wise.""""Wicked"" is well worth your time but you'll enjoy it infinitely more once you also see the show, and the show itself is well worth a weekend trip to the nearest city staging a production to see it.;"""
"""I haven't seen the show Wicked yet, bit I am aware that the show is currently playing in Chicago, at the Ford Center for the Performing Arts, Oriental Theatre, my family actually did have tickets to see this show, but we coudln't go the night that we had tickets for, and still haven't see it sinmce, so I don't know when I will see the show, even through I won't see the orginal cast, but it opened here, with the idea to keep it here as long as people liked it, and didn't get tired of it playing here, it actually opened wqith a different cast, that plated until mid June, which then had closed for 10 days, and opened with a Chicago cast. Kristin Chenoweth was apart of the orginal broadway cast, when it opened in New York, at the end of 2003, and they recored this cd and brought it. I bought a copy, but let me warn you that while the is 2 hours and 43 minutes, with a 15 minute intermission, the cd is 71 minutes long, but I also own a copy of Monty Python' Spamalot, and All Shook Up, and both are shorter then 60 mintues, so if you are in a hurry and want to hear the orginal broadway cast, those 2 cds will be better to listen to if you only have an hour to listneing to a broadway show. Stephen Oremus, who later did All Shook Up, that played in Chicago in Previews before oepnning offically in New York, is the Conductor and Director, but I think he is the musical director of the show, but I bet it would have been nice to see the broadway show with the orfinal cast, but it opened in New York, and that would be a far place to see the show. If you can spear 72 minutes of your life, then I urge you to take a listen to this show. But if you are in that much of a hurry then I reccoemend Spmalalot (if you also wanted to hear famous people's voices) or All Shook Up, Spamalot is almost 53 minutes long, and All Shook Up is almost 59 minutes long. But these are some good cds to listen to of the broadway cast, and that would be the orginal cast.;"""
"""I just saw this musical performance for the first time a little over a month ago.  Needless to say, I fell absolutely in love with it and bought this album the very next morning (getting the mp3 songs from Amazon instantly is awesome) and listened to it for a month straight without ever getting tired of it.  This is not something I normally do!The songs are a beautiful blend of fun, upbeat, lighthearted, and quirky - all very much reflective of the colorful, magical, and sometimes very strange and dark world of the Wizard of Oz on which it's based.  And yet there's such a surprising amount of emotional depth here too.  Every song recorded here manages to capture the irony, humor, heartbreak, loss, lies, and hope that are present in the actual performance.  And they're quite catchy too, lodging themselves in your head for days and weeks at a time.  Some of my favorites are ""Popular"", ""What is this Feeling?"" ""Dancing through Life"", ""Thank Goodness"", ""Defying Gravity"", and ""For Good"" (have I named them all yet??).Kristin Chenoweth and Idina Menzel are simply amazing here (as usual) and even better together!  Fortunately there are many songs for them to show off their defiant, loathing-laden, tear-jerking duets and harmonies and other musical terms I don't quite understand.At $7.00 right now for both the physical CD album and the mp3s, it's a steal worth stealing.  This was my very first Amazon purchase of 2017, and I don't regret it for a minute or a cent.;"""
"""I am a big fan of Gregory McQuires novels, 'Wicked' and 'Confessions Of An Ugly Step-Sister' being by far the best. The way he looks at the questions of good and evil is a recurring theme. No one truely thinks they are evil, just misunderstood. And 'Good' people (bible-waving happy clappers, et al) are equally questionable. In reality everyone thinks their actions are justfied and for the best.The news that 'Wicked' would be made into a musical floored me a little. I was eagerly awaiting the mega-bucks Hollwood adaptation that has been in the works for years with Demi Moore's production company. But a musical makes sense - Oz has always been a muscal world, and the medium it lends itself to colourful fantasy. Plus the characters can speak directly to the audience and tell us what they are thinking; hard to achieve in film.Being in Australia I knew it would be years before we got to see 'Wicked' on stage, so  ordered the cast recording from amazon. At first I wasn't a fan of the music. I thought it was a little too Disney, and once I discovered the composers credentials lay in 'Beauty And The Beast' and 'Poccahontas', I shuddered. Elphaba sounds more like Arial from 'The Little Mermaid' than the dark and deep creature created by McGuire. But credit to Stephen Schwartz, what seemed poppy and pretty on the surface soon turned out to have a very dark heart, which beautiflly reflects the themes. The songs get better and better on further listening, and the vocal performances are sensational, especially by Kristin Chenoweth (possibly the best name ever), who has a devilish sense of comic timing and manages the different faces of Glinda (sweet Valley Girl 'Clueless' to the operatic high As.) She is hilarious and a stand-out talent. She made this recording for me and I would hate to be another performer stepping into her role.Beautifully scored and performed, packed full of humour, and wth a story line that has been even further developed by the remarkable Winnie Holtzman, 'Wicked' is a fully realized and magical experience. Now if it would just head Down Under...;"""
"""WICKED is an outstanding new musical from the pen of Stephen Schwatz (PIPPIN, THE BAKER'S WIFE) based on the novel of the same name by Gregory Maguire.  This musical is probably the Great White Hope of the 2003-04 Broadway season.Maguire's novel recounts the early lives of Oz's Glinda (the Good Witch of the North) and Elphaba (the Wicked Witch of the West), long before Dorothy and her house dropped into the story.Kristin Chenoweth (STEEL PIER, ANNIE) and Idina Menzel (RENT) play, respectively, Glinda and Elphaba.The musical is told in flashback as Glinda recalls meeting Elphaba at Shiz University, where the two aspiring students became room-mates.  Elphaba is treated as an outcast because of her green skin, but soon shows much promise, and is groomed as the protege of the Wizard (Joel Grey - CABARET, CHICAGO).  Glinda becomes romantically involved with the handsome yet shallow Prince Fiyero (Norbert Leo Butz), though he soon begins to take a fancy to Elphaba's charms.  Elphaba's crippled sister  Nessarose (played by Michelle Federer)  who would become the Wicked Witch of the East  - the one Dorothy's house drops on -  also figures heavily in the action.  Carole Shelley also impresses with a masterful performance as the corrupt college dean Madame Morrible, with fine support from Christopher Fitzgerald (BABES IN ARMS) as Nessarose's munchkin companion Boq.Stephen Schwartz, with Winnie Holzman's libretto, streamlines Gregory Maguire's sprawling, complicated novel, with a charming and imaginative score.  Standout numbers include ""Popular"", ""I'm Not That Girl"", ""Defying Gravity"" and the effective opening number (which sums up the theme of the show) called ""No-one Mourns the Wicked"".A must-own!;"""
"""I do not understand (and want you to disregard) those reviews written by people who have experienced only either this CD or the show. Please find reviews who have watched the show AND listened this CD.I bought this CD after I purchase the musical ticket but before watching the show. I kind of prepared for the show (and that is what I do to understand the show performance better). My first impression for the CD is not the greatest - it is like 3 stars out of 5. It sounds more like.... very well singing amateurs rather than professionals. Notes and voices are not too stable making you lose focus to the music.Then I saw the show - well played and well made, very creative story. Now I see why people give this musical as good reviews as the 4 major musicals. The casts actually sang better than the CD casts and I thought the CD can be better if re-recorded. Here this CD earned one more star from me, because of the show.Then I listened the CD again - it brouhgt all the scenes and memories from the musical. I can picture the scenes by each song.I personally think all the mucial sound track CDs are for those who wants to keep the memories from the show after wathcing the show. I don't think the intention was to replace whole musical with this one set of CD so that you do not have to watch the show. It is like you buy a Harry Potter movie scripts instead of the novel book then say ""this book is horrible"".Conclusion: CD perfomance = 3 stars, CD with the memories from the show = 4 stars;"""
"""I haven't seen the Broadway show, so I can't say much about it. Also excellent, not that this is a surprise, is Joel Grey, who plays the Wizard with tremendous charm and an undercurrent of dangerous mania.  The orchestra turns in a beautiful performance on this recording, as well.If you happen to be unfamiliar with the story of ""Wicked,"" it's a take-off on ""The Wizard of Oz"" in which we learn the origins and background of the Wicked Witch of the West. """I just pulled it out of the box and set it up. Very easy and the step-by-step process is neat and organized. I do need to note that the front slot is NOT a scanner. It is used to print different types of paper, letter envelopes, etc without the need to remove all the paper from the tray, kinda neat... I would have liked that feature advertised a bit more because I spent about two hours of my life trying to figure out why I could not scan anything with it and never ran into any information that told me it was not a scanner. Fortunately for me, I have a second printer that I can use to scan, no problem. But if you are buying this print as an ALL-IN-ONE, I am sorry to say you will be disappointed at the least. My only other concern is that I purchased this printer for around $250 USD but just the color toners alone without the black is around $300 USD for the high-yield package (2500 pages/color) It comes with toners in the 1500 pages/color range with is a lot for me... but you may want to consider your options when looking into these types of printers and compare with your needs, wants, and desires to see if this printer will fulfill the job or a smaller/larger printer may be the one you need. Plus the need for the scan feature.;"""
"""(In case you don‚Äôt care to read the following essay, I just need to say, Amazon is amazing and their customer service always goes above and beyond. THANK YOU AMAZON. Ceasing with the butt kissing now.)Unless you love wasting money and toner, DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL!Imagine this nightmare I'm living:You have a project due the next day, but you're not sweating it. This printer is new, it's not going to give you any problems. Except it decides it's done using the toner left in its cartridge. It hasn't even made it to 1,000 pages - it makes it to 799. Are those 799 full ink pages? No. It's mostly one address per page printed in size 14 font. This printer has been hijacked until you buy a brand new Brother brand toner cartridge. You then spend an hour with a Brother rep:Us: Yes. I need to reset the toner. I was able to do it on previous models by pressing cancel and secure, but the buttons aren't working on this one.Brother Rep: I can help you with that!Us: Thank you, that would be great.Brother Rep: You are welcome.Brother Rep: Did you replace the toner?Us: No, it doesn't need to be replaced, it needs to be reset.Brother Rep: Are you getting an error on the brother machine's display?Us: Yes, it says replace toner cartridge black (bk).Brother Rep: Thank you. Did you recently replace the black toner cartridge?Us: No, it has not been replaced since we bought it, we've hardly used it.Brother Rep: Thank you.Brother Rep: Thank you for waiting. There is no toner reset steps for the HLL3210CW. Also, the machine comes with a starter cartridge that prints approximately 1,000 pages.Brother Rep: The approximate toner yield is in accordance with the testing protocol ISO/IEC 19798 (Letter). The testing protocol involves continuous printing of a 5% coverage sample page of text. Users who typically print documents with a toner coverage higher than 5% should expect a lower page yield per toner cartridge.Brother Rep: In order to remove the ""replace toner"" message, you would have to replace the toner cartridge.Us: So because the black toner is ""out"", the entire printer is hijacked? What if I no longer wish to print with black ink, and only want to use yellow, magenta, or cyan?Brother Rep: <SPAN><DIV><DIV>Your printer is designed to stop ALL printing operations when any of the toner cartridges have reached their end-of-life.Us: So Brother completely did away with being able to reset the toners?Brother Rep: No, however, your machine does not have the option to reset the toner count. If there is an issue with the toner, you have a 90 day warranty.Us: The printer itself has a 1-year warranty. What does that cover? Brother Rep: One moment.Brother Rep: I am still working with you.Us: GreatBrother Rep: Thanks.Brother Rep: Thank you for waiting. The 1-year warranty covers a 1 year exchange for any mechanical malfunctions.Us: I feel this issue is a mechanical malfunction since the three previous Brother printers had manual toner reset functions, but I'm guessing Brother doesn't feel that way?Brother Rep: Please wait.Brother Rep: Please press the up or down arrow and select machine info.Us: okayBrother Rep: Then check the page counter.Us: Black is at 799. Does it count how many pages come out of the machine?Or how many full 8.5x11 pages of ink have been used? Because the main thing we use this printer for is printing one address on a 5x7 piece of paper.Brother Rep: How many pages.Brother Rep: The starter cartridge that prints approximately 1,000 pages.Brother Rep You will need to replace the toner.Brother Rep: The testing protocol involves continuous printing of a 5% coverage sample page of text. Users who typically print documents with a toner coverage higher than 5% should expect a lower page yield per toner cartridge.Brother Rep: If you would like to confirm this, please contact s via phone. Phone support is available at 1-877-276-8437. We are open Monday through Friday, 9am to 9pm Eastern time.Commencing rant: Depending on which Brother printer you have, how well you Google and YouTube, and whether or not you have turned off the auto-update firmware, you might be able to reset the toner, which will allow you to (SHOCKINGLY) use up the toner that's still left in the cartridge. Often, for hundreds of pages more. However, Brother is a greedy planet hater, a killer of the environment. They would rather you spend your hard-earned money and throw a still-good chunk of plastic away than actually let you use up what they have given you, what you have already paid for.We should be allowed to use the ink until it starts to fade! I have the right to a barely readable printout! I have the right to chose to switch to blue ink if the black is out. Except Brother says I don‚Äôt. I have to buy and replace the black ink before I can use any other ink. ""Sucks to be you,"" says Brother.;"""

It will it you go to printrr preferences through control panel and choose monochrome instead of colorI also wanted a printer that works with a smart plug and it does as well. I print a lot of shipping labels which is why I wanted monochrome with color.Quiet mode is nice. Control panel makes it easy to customize settings;"""

"""In a NutshellI have a Brother P-Touch handheld labeller and it's great for a lot of uses, but if you're creating a lot of labels, it's a pain in the you-know-where. I got this Dymo heavily discounted and I like that I can make a lot of labels at once on my computer. No fumbling with a function key to get numbers, symbols and other typographic changes. My score is based on the price I paid. If you're paying full price, then I would knock a star off.The Good Parts* It's just like a printer - you can use different fonts and even add images to your labels* It has built in-storage containing the software (Windows and Mac I believe) to create your labels* Design software is easy to use. The advanced software available from Dymo's site is even better.* OK looking design, but a little oversized* You can get noname replacement tapes to save money(although I haven't tried them)* I believe there is a limited selection of tape widths too - which offers you some flexibilityNot So Great* Small fonts don't look too great (i.e. if you make a four line label)* Not high resolution, but satisfactory for most needs* At full price, not the best value. Get it when it's on sale* Less portable than the handheld labellers since it needs a computer.Tips* I don't use the bundled software on the device - I use the more advanced label designer that you can get from the Dymo web site;"""
"""This thing is just awesome.  It works better than I expected.  As soon as you plug it in, windows loads it as a external drive..  if autoplay is enabled, the lightweight application launches, otherwise just go run the executable on the mounted drive.  It's literally plug n' play - nothing to install, no new icons cluttering up your start menu, no end use license agreement, etc.Within the small lightweight application, you can use any of your system fonts and even insert images and they print out on the label.  Much more versatility than a handheld.  You can also set a fixed-width for the label and the text/images adjust in size accordingly or let the width be automatic based on your selection of font size.  You can mix fonts, sizes, etc on a single label.  The fixed width works well for making labels for folders, etc.It's small and fits in a regular desk drawer without any problem.  It seems to have a battery that charges but I don't know what the purpose of that would be since you need to it plugged in to USB to use as best as I can tell.;"""
"""Purchased for occasional use at our lab (university electronics research lab).Works well and painlessly. However, DYMO have made the odd choice of using an internal rechargeable battery, rather than operating off USB or an external power source, which I suspect will severely limit the life of this product given that we intend to only make very occasional use of it.The built-in software is very limiting compared to a similar now discontinued product from Brother that I use at home - in particular, it does not allow the easy creation of a text box/frame, to easily enter print multiple blocks of multiline text on one strip of label.;"""
"""Easy to use, no installation needed (so no Administrator access needed to use) : the printer acts as a USB key which has all the needed app. You can even print pictures, on top of all the usual function you get from a standalone labeller. The only downside, except for the price of the label refills, is that the printing quality is not as good as other labeller I've seen. I got is for 20$, is is worth it. I wouldn't invest over 30$ for it though, a standalone labeller would be more efficient at that price range.;"""
"""Overall a good label maker, but would prefer that it use more of the label for a bigger print.;"""
"""I had a problem installing this on my new Mac.  I contacted Dymo and their representative was excellent.  She eventually sorted the problem and everything is working fine now. """I have one of those all-in-one ink jet printers. Great to print documents but not so much for decent images.  Ink is pricey & there is always the hassle of at least one cartridge running out of ink not to mention changing cartridges & getting printer back up to proceed. I needed a fast, easy & inexpensive way to print a bunch of images for court filing. After much research, reading consumer reviews & watching videos, I chose the Canon Selphy CP1300.  Fast Amazon shipping had it in my hands in no time. It is compact but solid. Instructions were pretty straight forward & easy enough to follow.  Had that printer up and running in less time than it takes to cook a pot of grits. I figure if this ol‚Äô 70+ granny can do it then easy peasy for others.Before printing make sure nothing is against back of the printer like the power cord that would impede the paper as it goes back and forth when printing.Quality‚Ä¶Ok, not that of an expensive pigment ink archival large format printer (which I use to own for award winning prints) but a darn good better than most of those cheap ink jets!You are limited to no larger than a 4‚Äùx6‚Äù print but that meets my needs.The Canon paper/ink bundle includes 10 prepackaged paper, 18 sheets in each pack as that is max number of sheets in the tray at one time. That‚Äôs enough paper for 108 4‚Äùx6‚Äù prints.  There are also 3 ink cartridges, so I‚Äôm assuming one cartridge will handle 36 prints. $30 price range is very reasonable for this many prints, especially when compared to using ink jet printers with 4-6 different color cartridges that when one goes empty you can‚Äôt proceed until it‚Äôs replaced!I don‚Äôt know how Canon does it but the prints are not only archival for up to 100 years but they come out smudge and water proof out of the tray!  I managed to get some glue stick residue on front of a couple of prints while affixing to documents. I used a damp tissue and wiped it all off without any damage to the prints!Can‚Äôt wait to start printing off those grandbaby pics!Special note:  The printer only comes with 5 sheets and one cartridge that only prints 5 so be sure to order at least one box set of additional Canon paper and ink cartridges!;"""

"""Avevo bisogno di pi√π spazio per lo storage di file,principalmente foto,documenti e video di famiglia,con anche un p√≤ di spazio per installare qualche giocoche non trovava posto nei miei SSD M2;Ci√≤ detto e avendo anche SSD della serie MX500 e Samsung870 Evo entrambi da 2tb,mi serviva sostituire un SSDMX300 da 525gb con un modello pi√π capiente giustoper portare i miei drive di storage tutti a 2TBognuno.Un esigenza pi√π legata alla voglia di non perdere tempoa ""scremare"" i miei drive per recuperare spazio che peruna vera necessit√†.Comunque l'occhio mi √® caduto su questo modello della Cruciale costando circa 40/50 euro in meno dei modelli sopra citatie per l'uso che mi serviva,ho preferito risparmiare qualcheeuro a fronte di prestazioni ""leggermente"" inferiori cheapprofondir√≤ pi√π avanti.Il prodotto si presenta tutto nero,la copertura a vista √®in plastica,molto semplice e sensibilmente pi√π economicache incide sul prezzo finale,la parte sottostante checomprende i connettori,l'etichetta etc √® in alluminiosempre di colore nero.La confezione e il suo contenuto √® visibile nelle foto allegate.Ma in pratica una vaschetta in plastica che contiene il drive,un manuale e nient'altro,ne supporti per drive,niente viti,insomma contenuto ridotto all'osso.C'√® differenza tra il modello BX500 da 480GB e la versioneda 1Tb e da 2Tb,il primo adotta:il Silicon Motion 2258XT con memorie TLC a 64LayerMentre nella versione da 1 e 2 TB c'√®:Il Silicon Motion 2259XT con memorie TLC a 96LayerLe prestazioni del modello da 2TB fanno eco ai picchidella connettivit√† SATA 6 Gbps,offrendo fino a 540 MB/sin lettura e fino 500 MB/s in scrittura (vedi foto)con una resistenza TBW di circa 390 GB al giornoper cinque anni anche se la garanzia ufficiale dicrucial sul BX √® di 3 anni.L'MTBF √® stato fissato a 1,5 milioni di ore,mentre lefunzionalit√† avanzate includono l'accelerazione dellascrittura SLC,TRIM e il supporto SMART.Prestazioni di tutto rispetto e resistenza TWB decisamentesoddisfacente,quindi dove viene meno il BX?Ora ve lo spiego:Questo drive non adotta DRAMCache,in gergo √® un drive DramLess,significa che non ha una memoria di transito che aiuta neltrasferimento di grossi file e quindi grandi carichi discrittura,questa specifica funzione √® tutta a carico delcontroller.In parole molto comprensibili significa che se lo usiamo in modoprofessionale,trasferendo quotidianamente su di esso grandiquantit√† di dati,parliamo di almeno 200 Gigabyte in un colpo solo,e in modo continuativo per tutto l'arco della giornata,una voltache il controller arriva al suo limite,il trasferimento rallentaanche in modo abbastanza evidente fino al completamentodel carico di lavoro.Questo particolare scenario,prettamente specifico dell'ambitoprofessionale √® il solo limite di questa unit√† per la qualetuttavia non √® stato concepito,la mancanza della DRAMgiustifica un prezzo pi√π basso;Rallenta nelle prestazioni quando inizia ad essere riempito? """O produto deu problema com 1 m√™s, n√£o carrega nem com o cabo e nem na base... Carrega por alguns segundos e para.;"""
"""I purchased this Bose Soundlink Revolve series II to replace an older UE Megaboom that was no longer holding a battery charge.First of alI, I was impressed by how easy it was to pair the bluetooth with our Android phones and our Samsung tablet.The controls are easily accessible on the top, and fairly intuitive. I also purchased the companion charging base, which certainly is not a necessity, but is convenient, and not outrageously priced.I was a little surprised at the diminutive size; this unit is much smaller than the Megaboom, with far less pronounced bass, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The Megaboom was just that - ""boomy"". The Bose is much tighter in the low end and due to its size and weight, is easily portable.To my ears, the sound is pretty much omnidirectional as advertised. I walked in circles around it with music playing and did not notice any real hotspots or dead zones. Fairly even spread.Now let me state what this is NOT: Loud. If you are looking for a party speaker that will make your local DJ envious, this is not the product you are looking for.My wife and I are musicians, and we own professional sound equipment that will shake the walls and rattle the windows. I did not buy this Bose unit to do that. I wanted something that would allow us to have background music playing at a small gathering, while not overpowering normal conversation, or for when my wife and I are sitting on the patio by the firepit listening to oldies. For this use, it is perfect! Enough volume to clearly hear the tunes, but not so loud as to bother the neighbors.Battery life is advertised as ""up to"" 13 hours (and the Browns may win the Super Bowl). That's far longer than we will likely ever need, and I haven't tested its limits yet. In fact, we leave it on the charging base most of the time. Personally, I'll be happy if it gives us four hours of battery play time.In summary, it's Bose...legendary quality and distinctive ""Bose"" sound. If you're not a confirmed, Bose-hating audiophile, or expecting a PA system, this little thing could be exactly what you're looking for!My verdict: Recommended.;"""
"""Bose SoundLink Revolve (Series II) emerges as a true revolution. This portable marvel, dear reader, is a symphony of auditory delight that has left me in a state of rapture.From the first note that emanates from this speaker, a world of sonic exploration unfolds before my ears. Theses speakers boast a mesmerizing audio quality that transports me into a realm of pure auditory pleasure. It delivers an immersive experience that captivates the senses, allowing music to come alive in vibrant clarity.The price tag attached to this portable Bluetooth speaker may raise eyebrows, but fear not. While it may be on the higher end, it is not so overpriced as to deter me from keeping it. In fact, its performance left me craving more, leading me to acquire not just one, but two additional units. The ability to pair them has opened up a world of auditory ecstasy as the music follows me seamlessly from room to room, indoors and outdoors.The versatility is a testament to its engineering brilliance. It creates an atmosphere of sonic harmony, allowing music to caress the ears regardless of one's physical location. The seamless transition from indoors to outdoors, from one room to another, ensures that no moment of melodic pleasure is lost.So, embrace the sonic revolution, embrace the Bose SoundLink Revolve (Series II), and let music become the soundtrack to your traversing adventures. Pair these speakers and immerse yourself in a symphony that transcends boundaries. With this portable Bluetooth speaker, you have the power to create a world of auditory bliss that knows no limits.;"""
"""Been using our Bose Soundlink Mini for years, so figured it was time for an upgrade. Wished I hadn't waited so long: the Revolve II is a big step up in terms of sound quality and presence - it totally fills our 2,000 sf main floor with sound. For example, at the end of one jazz piece we often listen to, heard for the first time the sound of the pianist taking his foot off the sustain pedal from across the room. Highly recommend!;"""
"""We have 3 Bose Revolve speakers in our home, My wife, my son and I all have our own. I bought my wife the smaller Revolve II because she doesn't listen to her music real loud and it costs a lot less than the larger ones that my son and I have. To my surprise, you have to really listen carefully to tell the difference in volume and sound quality between the larger Bose Revolve and the smaller Revolve II.  When I purchased my Revolve speaker, I went to Fry's and listened to about 10 different portable speakers. The Bose Revolve had the best sound quality of all of them. I've had mine for 8 years now, I use it a lot and the sound is just as good as new and the battery still holds a charge for weeks at a time.;"""
"""Amazing sound that fills any residential-intimate outdoor space and comes packaged in a sleek, adorable design. This Bose Soundlink Revolve has lived in my suitcase and been used every day for 6+ months; it sounds as rich and dynamic as ever! It isn't the lightest option but it IS the richest sound for the speaker weight. If you want lightest go for Bose sound canceling earbuds or Bose sound canceling head set. If you want to beef up your laptop or iPad sound or share a Netflix with someone in the evening, Bose Soundlink Revolve is THE ANSWER. This is my 7th Bose product and the design, price point and sound continues to astonish. No need to hesitate on this one!;"""

"""I purchased this Bose Soundlink Revolve series II to replace an older UE Megaboom that was no longer holding a battery charge.First of alI, I was impressed by how easy it was to pair the bluetooth with our Android phones and our Samsung tablet.The controls are easily accessible on the top, and fairly intuitive. I also purchased the companion charging base, which certainly is not a necessity, but is convenient, and not outrageously priced.I was a little surprised at the diminutive size; this unit is much smaller than the Megaboom, with far less pronounced bass, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The Megaboom was just that - ""boomy"". The Bose is much tighter in the low end and due to its size and weight, is easily portable.To my ears, the sound is pretty much omnidirectional as advertised. I walked in circles around it with music playing and did not notice any real hotspots or dead zones. Fairly even spread.Now let me state what this is NOT: Loud. If you are looking for a party speaker that will make your local DJ envious, this is not the product you are looking for.My wife and I are musicians, and we own professional sound equipment that will shake the walls and rattle the windows. I did not buy this Bose unit to do that. I wanted something that would allow us to have background music playing at a small gathering, while not overpowering normal conversation, or for when my wife and I are sitting on the patio by the firepit listening to oldies. For this use, it is perfect! Enough volume to clearly hear the tunes, but not so loud as to bother the neighbors.Battery life is advertised as ""up to"" 13 hours (and the Browns may win the Super Bowl). That's far longer than we will likely ever need, and I haven't tested its limits yet. In fact, we leave it on the charging base most of the time. Personally, I'll be happy if it gives us four hours of battery play time.In summary, it's Bose...legendary quality and distinctive ""Bose"" sound. If you're not a confirmed, Bose-hating audiophile, or expecting a PA system, this little thing could be exactly what you're looking for!My verdict: Recommended.;"""

It delivers an immersive experience that captivates the senses, allowing music to come alive in vibrant clarity.The price tag attached to this portable Bluetooth speaker may raise eyebrows, but fear not. While it may be on the higher end, it is not so overpriced as to deter me from keeping it. In fact, its performance left me craving more, leading me to acquire not just one, but two additional units. It creates an atmosphere of sonic harmony, allowing music to caress the ears regardless of one's physical location. The seamless transition from indoors to outdoors, from one room to another, ensures that no moment of melodic pleasure is lost.So, embrace the sonic revolution, embrace the Bose SoundLink Revolve (Series II), and let music become the soundtrack to your traversing adventures. """I was looking for a lightweight speaker for use mainly outdoors, where I wouldn't want to crank the volume up too loud, and it was either this one or the JBL Flip 6 which is about ¬£30 cheaper.Having used a Bose Soundlink, designed to drop iPod into for years (with a bluetooth adapter) I was really please with the build quality and the sound, so decided to go with the Flex.The sound quality is excellent and gives a really ""big"" sound, if you didn't see the unit, you'd think it was much larger to achieve such a soundIt's very bass heavy, which may not please some people, but considering there's only one drive unit in it, it handles the range of frequencies very well, and when turned up load, really fills a room without noticeable distortion. Gives a really good thumping sound to Techno and rock music, but equally gives a very pleasant rendering of a Beethoven Piano concerto..Always a ""shot in the dark"" buying audio equipment unheard, but I'm really happy with it,  It's water and dustproof, but that doesn't concern me, very well constructed and , for me anyway, a much nicer design than the generic cylindrical shape of most small speakers.I use it with an iPhone, and as with my Bose headphones, it connects instantly when it's switched on, giving and audio description  the battery level and the device connected. I've only tried it once receiving a phone call, and compared with the music sound level, the audio was very very  quiet, and I had to turn the volume up to full to  just about hear it, so that may be an issue if the ability to use it for phone calls was a deciding factor for purchase. All in all though,  a great little speaker.;"""
"""Dal titolo ho voluto riassumere la mia esperienza. S√¨ perch√© a chi non capita su delle note di una canzone di chiudere gli occhi e rilassarsi. """I bought a pair of these to have stereo sound on an outdoor rooftop. I got them instead of outdoor speakers, cheaper and I could change the position of them easily. They are a slight pain to pair sometimes... Especially if your phone automatically connects to both of them when they switch on. You can use a combination of buttons or the app to pair, but sometimes it just doesn't work straight away. The sound however is awesome for such small and compact speakers. On their own they don't produce stereo sound (its mixed mono) , but once the second one is connected and positioned as a left / right it opens up a nice 'soundstage'. Music is meant to be listened to with speaker separation... Why i have two of every Bluetooth speaker I own. Clarity is excellent, volume is great, bass is good at low to mid volumes, but doesn't keep pushing at higher volumes. Build quality and battery life are good too. I'd certainly recommend one on its own, and as a pair if you're patient with the pairing process. 4.5 stars;"""

"""I was looking for a lightweight speaker for use mainly outdoors, where I wouldn't want to crank the volume up too loud, and it was either this one or the JBL Flip 6 which is about ¬£30 cheaper.Having used a Bose Soundlink, designed to drop iPod into for years (with a bluetooth adapter) I was really please with the build quality and the sound, so decided to go with the Flex.The sound quality is excellent and gives a really ""big"" sound, if you didn't see the unit, you'd think it was much larger to achieve such a soundIt's very bass heavy, which may not please some people, but considering there's only one drive unit in it, it handles the range of frequencies very well, and when turned up load, really fills a room without noticeable distortion. Gives a really good thumping sound to Techno and rock music, but equally gives a very pleasant rendering of a Beethoven Piano concerto..Always a ""shot in the dark"" buying audio equipment unheard, but I'm really happy with it,  It's water and dustproof, but that doesn't concern me, very well constructed and , for me anyway, a much nicer design than the generic cylindrical shape of most small speakers.I use it with an iPhone, and as with my Bose headphones, it connects instantly when it's switched on, giving and audio description  the battery level and the device connected. I've only tried it once receiving a phone call, and compared with the music sound level, the audio was very very  quiet, and I had to turn the volume up to full to  just about hear it, so that may be an issue if the ability to use it for phone calls was a deciding factor for purchase. All in all though,  a great little speaker.;"""

"""I bought a pair of these to have stereo sound on an outdoor rooftop. I got them instead of outdoor speakers, cheaper and I could change the position of them easily. They are a slight pain to pair sometimes... Especially if your phone automatically connects to both of them when they switch on. You can use a combination of buttons or the app to pair, but sometimes it just doesn't work straight away. The sound however is awesome for such small and compact speakers. """Melhor aparelho de barbear que j√° usei;"""
"""Muito bom;"""
"""I ordered this product just because of Braun & also saw many positive reviews but after using it for few months,  Compared to the traditional razor -1. It takes a lot of time to shave with electric razor2. You cannot shave beard which is more unshaved for more than 2 weeks with electric razor.3. Cleaning is easier but within 3 months of usage blade got damaged, not so great quality.4. Some areas under the chin was hard to shave with electric and I had to repeat shaving multiple times in the same spot, I have moved back to regular razor and probably use this once in a while.;"""
"""Over one year later:  Still working well.  No complaints.  The battery is maybe at 80% capacity now, but no real issues.Edit 4/9/22:  Expect this thing to last maybe 1.5 to 2 years.  The battery will no longer hold a decent charge and the foil will need to be replaced.  I ended up getting a new one and don‚Äôt regret it.  It‚Äôs still cheaper and more convenient than using razors.  Comparing the new unit to the 1.5 year old model is night and day. The new unit cuts faster, more easily, better, and holds an amazing charge just like the old one used to.So let me start by pointing out the obvious after having used many electric razors over the years at various price points.  This is not an expensive or top of the line electric razor.  This razor simply can‚Äôt be compared to the Braun Series 9 and especially should never be compared to a sharp, new, razor blade made for shaving with shaving cream.  Even if you spend $1000, an electric razor will never compete with a halfway decent razor and good old fashioned shaving cream.  Secondly, it should be pointed out that different electric razors will interact with different types of skin, facial structures, and facial hair differently.  One person will have a much different experience from the next and will have various opinions based on their expectations.  These are facts regardless of the technology and price point.  I mention this because some of the reviews have somewhat unrealistic expectations.  In my personal experience, I wanted an affordable electric razor for occasional use that didn‚Äôt give me shave bumps or razor burn as I have skin issues like eczema.  I realized that the shave wouldn‚Äôt be perfect from prior experience with these things, but that it would be convenient when in a rush in the morning.  That is exactly what I got and I am happy with it.All that said, I do agree with some of the negatives mentioned.  No travel bag, no plastic protective cover, and no stand at this price point.  It is also true that it struggles getting those neck hairs.  Basically, after shaving with it, I look like I shaved from a foot away, but I don‚Äôt feel like I got a good shave.  It‚Äôs also true that this model lacks a connected trimmer like the previous generation.  If you want to manscape, you will need to manually remove the foil head and put on the trimmer head.  Kind of a pain, but I expected that and have a better Whal trimmer I much prefer anyway, so again, expectations managed.  I‚Äôve only had it a few weeks so I can‚Äôt speak to longevity.  Fingers crossed.  And yes, this is not the easiest to clean despite the new easy clean design.  Still, it‚Äôs not a deal breaker for me.Just a few electric shaver specific tips I find helpful.  One, foil shavers should not be used in a circle, but rather only up and down.  Two, shave the sensitive parts of your face or neck first.  The foil head heats up after (normal and typical) a while so the foil head will be cooler if you shave the sensitive areas first.  This helps with bumps and rash.  For me, that would be my neck and chin.  Three, don‚Äôt rub the foil viciously against your skin.  Most electric razors will give you razor burn if you push hard enough.  Pushing harder doesn‚Äôt really result in a better shave in my opinion.  Four, using a pre-shave lotion may help.  I only use this razor dry as it is more convenient and faster, otherwise why own an electric razor.  Finally, splash with some cold water after you finish.  The cold water will help calm your skin down and may result in fewer bumps or razor rashes for those with sensitive skin.Hope this helps.  I would rate this one 4.5 stars so far.  We‚Äôll see if it lasts.  The reality of electric razors, especially at this price point, is that they will do an okay job that may be good enough for you.  It won‚Äôt be perfect and it will never compete with a real razor.  I think if most knew that going in, this would have slightly better ratings.;"""
"""I use this razor as a travel item and works great for me. I bought this as a recommendation from a friend and I am very satisfied.;"""
"""Gives me a clean shave. Like the battery life and the shaver is a big improvement over my Series 3. Light weight and ergonomic.;"""

"""I ordered this product just because of Braun & also saw many positive reviews but after using it for few months,  Compared to the traditional razor -1. """Over one year later:  Still working well.  No complaints.  The battery is maybe at 80% capacity now, but no real issues.Edit 4/9/22:  Expect this thing to last maybe 1.5 to 2 years.  The battery will no longer hold a decent charge and the foil will need to be replaced.  I ended up getting a new one and don‚Äôt regret it.  It‚Äôs still cheaper and more convenient than using razors.  Comparing the new unit to the 1.5 year old model is night and day. The new unit cuts faster, more easily, better, and holds an amazing charge just like the old one used to.So let me start by pointing out the obvious after having used many electric razors over the years at various price points.  This is not an expensive or top of the line electric razor.  This razor simply can‚Äôt be compared to the Braun Series 9 and especially should never be compared to a sharp, new, razor blade made for shaving with shaving cream.  Even if you spend $1000, an electric razor will never compete with a halfway decent razor and good old fashioned shaving cream.  Secondly, it should be pointed out that different electric razors will interact with different types of skin, facial structures, and facial hair differently.  One person will have a much different experience from the next and will have various opinions based on their expectations.  These are facts regardless of the technology and price point.  I mention this because some of the reviews have somewhat unrealistic expectations.  In my personal experience, I wanted an affordable electric razor for occasional use that didn‚Äôt give me shave bumps or razor burn as I have skin issues like eczema.  I realized that the shave wouldn‚Äôt be perfect from prior experience with these things, but that it would be convenient when in a rush in the morning.  That is exactly what I got and I am happy with it.All that said, I do agree with some of the negatives mentioned.  No travel bag, no plastic protective cover, and no stand at this price point.  It is also true that it struggles getting those neck hairs.  Basically, after shaving with it, I look like I shaved from a foot away, but I don‚Äôt feel like I got a good shave.  It‚Äôs also true that this model lacks a connected trimmer like the previous generation.  If you want to manscape, you will need to manually remove the foil head and put on the trimmer head.  Kind of a pain, but I expected that and have a better Whal trimmer I much prefer anyway, so again, expectations managed.  I‚Äôve only had it a few weeks so I can‚Äôt speak to longevity.  Fingers crossed.  And yes, this is not the easiest to clean despite the new easy clean design.  Still, it‚Äôs not a deal breaker for me.Just a few electric shaver specific tips I find helpful.  One, foil shavers should not be used in a circle, but rather only up and down.  Two, shave the sensitive parts of your face or neck first.  The foil head heats up after (normal and typical) a while so the foil head will be cooler if you shave the sensitive areas first.  This helps with bumps and rash.  For me, that would be my neck and chin.  Three, don‚Äôt rub the foil viciously against your skin.  Most electric razors will give you razor burn if you push hard enough.  Pushing harder doesn‚Äôt really result in a better shave in my opinion.  Four, using a pre-shave lotion may help.  I only use this razor dry as it is more convenient and faster, otherwise why own an electric razor.  Finally, splash with some cold water after you finish.  The cold water will help calm your skin down and may result in fewer bumps or razor rashes for those with sensitive skin.Hope this helps.  I would rate this one 4.5 stars so far.  We‚Äôll see if it lasts.  The reality of electric razors, especially at this price point, is that they will do an okay job that may be good enough for you.  It won‚Äôt be perfect and it will never compete with a real razor.  I think if most knew that going in, this would have slightly better ratings.;"""

"""O livro d√° uma revis√£o panor√¢mica nos circuitos e regi√µes cerebrais envolvidas na cogni√ß√£o social (""quente""). Ela √© contraposta a regi√µes da mem√≥ria de trabalho, cogni√ß√£o ""fria"". Facilmente compreens√≠vel por pessoas sem experi√™ncia pr√©via em neurosci√™ncias;"""
"""This is amazing book. It will clarify a lot of things that you probably noticed from your surroundings. It gives clarification on many questions one may ask. Here are some for example:How we as human beings see social threats? Why we fear reticulating in front of other people? Why we always tent to follow the crowd?I picked some interesting facts of the book. Our need to connect with other people is even more fundamental and basic than a need for food and shelter. We have a unique ability among species to read other peoples minds, to figure out their hopes, fears, and motivations, allowing us to effectively coordinate allies with one another.More reviews on my website http://adamwojnar.comWe are wired to be social. After food and shelter we need to meet social life, because we are not able to do anything else.At the age of 10 hour brain has done 10,000 hours work in social.When we don‚Äôt think of anything, our brain switches to solving social puzzles.Being with and around people means survive. Mother Theresa said that the most devastating thing what one can experience is to live without other people. Don‚Äôt always search in yourself. Look around to find out who you are. People give you feedback is all the time.Our brains want us to be average for survivor and safety. We are survivor machines. People who can be seen by cameras therefore punished by society behave better. Less stealing and breaking rules. The worst punishment is, what will others say.We won‚Äôt be good for the group because they reward us. The key is giving.Social pain is like physical pain. It helps us ensure the survival of our children by helping to keep them close today a parent. The new ruling between social and physical pain also ensures that staying social contact it will be a lifelong need, like food and warmth. Given the fact that our brains treat social and physical pain similarly, should we as a society treats social pain differently than we do?Our society has assumed the smartest among us are those who have particularly strong analytical skills. But from the listener in perspective, perhaps the smartest among us are actually dealt with the best social skills.I do not mean to suggest that physical and social pain are identical. No one has ever broken his arm and confused with having been dumped by his girlfriend. Memories of social pain are much more intense the memories of social pain. Different kinds of pain feel differently and have distinctive characteristics. Social pain is a real pain just as physical pain is real pain.‚Äì When we take a pill for headache it seems that it helps our feelings of heartache go away too.‚Äì Taking a pill for headache or physical pain had made the brain‚Äôs network less sensitive to the pain of rejection.‚Äì Mutual cooperation activates the reward system as an end in itself.All tests show that our supposed to be selfish and reward system seems to like giving more than receiving. Even test with children show that teenagers reported taking pleasure in helping their families in daily life, they also showed increased reward system activity when donating their money to the families.‚Äì Our cultural development of skills and habits depends on our capacity of imitation.‚Äì If the person is unable to mimic those facial expressions because of recent Botox injections that actually paralyze the expressive muscles in the face, that person will actually be worse at recognizing emotions in others.‚Äì Our self works for a group to ensure that we will fit in. Most of us will conform to group norms, promoting social harmony.‚Äì Possibility of being judged and evaluated by others dramatically increases our tendency to behave in line with societies values and morals.The message is clear I‚Äôll brain is profoundly social, with some of the oldies social wiring dating back more than hundred million years. Our wiring motivates us to stay connected. It returned our attention again and again to understanding the minds of the people around us like a rubber band snapping back into place.More reviews on my website http://adamwojnar.com;"""
"""Matthew Lieberman‚Äôs book is good: it reads well, the structure is helpful and linear for the general-interest reader while also offering some depth for the detail-oriented bookworm or specialist. However, it sometimes overstretches in its interpretation of the brain activity generated in the experiments it considers. This is a classic problem, and the fact that it is starting to be solved within the neuro-science community means that the field is less likely to end up as the phrenology of the 21st century.Lieberman makes clear that there are brain networks primarily in charge of social, self-referential and ‚Äúmind-wandering‚Äù thoughts, and other networks that take care of problem-solving and analytical thinking, and these networks are both considered in building the case for how our brains make us human.And two things for sure make us human: the fact that you can think what the other person thinks that you think (called higher-order theory of mind, and beautifully illustrated by the rock/paper/scissors game), and that we can project ourselves into the future (called long-term planning prediction and anticipation). No other animal can go that far; and the fact that humans created culture means that we have greatly complicated the inferences we can make regarding the evolutionary advantages of specific but complex behaviours such as altruism.This apparently ‚Äúhuman-only‚Äù characteristic is also well considered here, and it‚Äôs worth weighing Lieberman‚Äôs hypothesis about why we tend to avoid boasting about helping others and see it as a rewarding thing in itself.Lieberman strikes me as an honest scientist, diligently searching for answers about why we feel pain on a psychological level (the end of a relationship, the death of a parent), or why we feel rewarded by praise or when we give money to strangers.These are not new ideas, but Lieberman, like all original researchers, asks the right questions, looks for the best experiment to do, and tries to answer in light of real neural mechanisms. Classic social scientists are afraid of his kind. He is a threat to all those dark-matter classical psychologists who either backbench from half-dead theories or perform experiments sitting in their black boxes, where the mechanisms of ‚Äúhow behaviour happens‚Äù appear to have nothing to do with the workings of the brain.I might not agree with some of the concepts Lieberman crafts from his experiments, but I am pleased that he shows determination in building a mechanistic, brain-grounded account of who we are. And surely one of the uses of this book should be as a spark to think about precisely that.Lieberman the scientist is a firm believer in the theory that we are wired to connect, or, to put it rather better, that we have evolved, through natural selection, to be social animals that thrive now in almost all ‚Äúecosystems‚Äù using the unique feature of mentalising; and that we cannot avoid thinking, and thinking what the other person is thinking‚Ä¶capisce? He brings the book to a courageous conclusion in his attempt to use ‚Äúsocial brain‚Äù concepts to guide policymaking. I cannot help but applaud any bid to use scientific evidence to back decisions for learning, business or politics in general. The way we are and how we think must be taken into account when deciding the kind of society we want ‚Äì and the good news is that it can be based on real research into who we are.;"""
"""Is it pure survival - or something far deeper? These are the types of questions asked and explored in this book on the need for human social interaction. Distinguishing humans from other mammals, Lieberman brings science to bear on why our social interactions are so critical, and what the implications are for the future of electronic connection and the era of ‚Äúbowling alone‚Äù. An interesting if somewhat difficult read.;"""
"""The book basically reviews recent brain science experiments, and how these relate to the society in which we live.  Don't let the science scare you, it is explained well.  The author makes an effort to explain the significance of the science experiments and only goes to the detail required to understand how it relates to the discussion at hand.The material will make you think and reflect.  The material has some counter intuitive punches that will reverse some of your previously conceived ideas about society.If you were to use current Canadian and US politics as representative of the state of society you might be a little cynical about societies future.  However within these pages there is some basic hope of how we are wired as humans that gives me hope, that we will overcome some of these issues in the future.One of the challenges is that the people who need to read the book won't, which is too bad, because if the science in the book is right, well that is why you need to read the book.If you care about society and where it is going, this will give you hope through scientific understanding.  If you only care about yourself, and how you can take advantage of society, you might want to read it, as you will probably discover your own worst enemy is yourself.  Ah, well poetic justice always makes for a good story.I will be reflecting on this material for sometime.  It will likely have to be read again, as while reading it the material sparked so many side trips in my wandering mind, that I had to often back track to reestablish contact with the author.  Again making it a worthwhile read.Be well, and treat each other excellently.  (Now there is scientific proof of this.);"""

"""Um assunto t√£o complexo escrito de forma f√°cil de entender. Realmente, o autor traduz o c√©rebro para nosso dia a dia. Mant√©m a aten√ß√£o com profundidade e beleza. O assunto √© fascinante.
