"""O livro d√° uma revis√£o panor√¢mica nos circuitos e regi√µes cerebrais envolvidas na cogni√ß√£o social (""quente""). Ela √© contraposta a regi√µes da mem√≥ria de trabalho, cogni√ß√£o ""fria"". Facilmente compreens√≠vel por pessoas sem experi√™ncia pr√©via em neurosci√™ncias;"""
"""This is amazing book. It will clarify a lot of things that you probably noticed from your surroundings. It gives clarification on many questions one may ask. Here are some for example:How we as human beings see social threats? Why we fear reticulating in front of other people? Why we always tent to follow the crowd?I picked some interesting facts of the book. Our need to connect with other people is even more fundamental and basic than a need for food and shelter. We have a unique ability among species to read other peoples minds, to figure out their hopes, fears, and motivations, allowing us to effectively coordinate allies with one another.More reviews on my website http://adamwojnar.comWe are wired to be social. After food and shelter we need to meet social life, because we are not able to do anything else.At the age of 10 hour brain has done 10,000 hours work in social.When we don‚Äôt think of anything, our brain switches to solving social puzzles.Being with and around people means survive. Mother Theresa said that the most devastating thing what one can experience is to live without other people. Don‚Äôt always search in yourself. Look around to find out who you are. People give you feedback is all the time.Our brains want us to be average for survivor and safety. We are survivor machines. People who can be seen by cameras therefore punished by society behave better. Less stealing and breaking rules. The worst punishment is, what will others say.We won‚Äôt be good for the group because they reward us. The key is giving.Social pain is like physical pain. It helps us ensure the survival of our children by helping to keep them close today a parent. The new ruling between social and physical pain also ensures that staying social contact it will be a lifelong need, like food and warmth. Given the fact that our brains treat social and physical pain similarly, should we as a society treats social pain differently than we do?Our society has assumed the smartest among us are those who have particularly strong analytical skills. But from the listener in perspective, perhaps the smartest among us are actually dealt with the best social skills.I do not mean to suggest that physical and social pain are identical. No one has ever broken his arm and confused with having been dumped by his girlfriend. Memories of social pain are much more intense the memories of social pain. Different kinds of pain feel differently and have distinctive characteristics. Social pain is a real pain just as physical pain is real pain.‚Äì When we take a pill for headache it seems that it helps our feelings of heartache go away too.‚Äì Taking a pill for headache or physical pain had made the brain‚Äôs network less sensitive to the pain of rejection.‚Äì Mutual cooperation activates the reward system as an end in itself.All tests show that our supposed to be selfish and reward system seems to like giving more than receiving. Even test with children show that teenagers reported taking pleasure in helping their families in daily life, they also showed increased reward system activity when donating their money to the families.‚Äì Our cultural development of skills and habits depends on our capacity of imitation.‚Äì If the person is unable to mimic those facial expressions because of recent Botox injections that actually paralyze the expressive muscles in the face, that person will actually be worse at recognizing emotions in others.‚Äì Our self works for a group to ensure that we will fit in. Most of us will conform to group norms, promoting social harmony.‚Äì Possibility of being judged and evaluated by others dramatically increases our tendency to behave in line with societies values and morals.The message is clear I‚Äôll brain is profoundly social, with some of the oldies social wiring dating back more than hundred million years. Our wiring motivates us to stay connected. It returned our attention again and again to understanding the minds of the people around us like a rubber band snapping back into place.More reviews on my website http://adamwojnar.com;"""
"""Matthew Lieberman‚Äôs book is good: it reads well, the structure is helpful and linear for the general-interest reader while also offering some depth for the detail-oriented bookworm or specialist. However, it sometimes overstretches in its interpretation of the brain activity generated in the experiments it considers. This is a classic problem, and the fact that it is starting to be solved within the neuro-science community means that the field is less likely to end up as the phrenology of the 21st century.Lieberman makes clear that there are brain networks primarily in charge of social, self-referential and ‚Äúmind-wandering‚Äù thoughts, and other networks that take care of problem-solving and analytical thinking, and these networks are both considered in building the case for how our brains make us human.And two things for sure make us human: the fact that you can think what the other person thinks that you think (called higher-order theory of mind, and beautifully illustrated by the rock/paper/scissors game), and that we can project ourselves into the future (called long-term planning prediction and anticipation). No other animal can go that far; and the fact that humans created culture means that we have greatly complicated the inferences we can make regarding the evolutionary advantages of specific but complex behaviours such as altruism.This apparently ‚Äúhuman-only‚Äù characteristic is also well considered here, and it‚Äôs worth weighing Lieberman‚Äôs hypothesis about why we tend to avoid boasting about helping others and see it as a rewarding thing in itself.Lieberman strikes me as an honest scientist, diligently searching for answers about why we feel pain on a psychological level (the end of a relationship, the death of a parent), or why we feel rewarded by praise or when we give money to strangers.These are not new ideas, but Lieberman, like all original researchers, asks the right questions, looks for the best experiment to do, and tries to answer in light of real neural mechanisms. Classic social scientists are afraid of his kind. He is a threat to all those dark-matter classical psychologists who either backbench from half-dead theories or perform experiments sitting in their black boxes, where the mechanisms of ‚Äúhow behaviour happens‚Äù appear to have nothing to do with the workings of the brain.I might not agree with some of the concepts Lieberman crafts from his experiments, but I am pleased that he shows determination in building a mechanistic, brain-grounded account of who we are. And surely one of the uses of this book should be as a spark to think about precisely that.Lieberman the scientist is a firm believer in the theory that we are wired to connect, or, to put it rather better, that we have evolved, through natural selection, to be social animals that thrive now in almost all ‚Äúecosystems‚Äù using the unique feature of mentalising; and that we cannot avoid thinking, and thinking what the other person is thinking‚Ä¶capisce? He brings the book to a courageous conclusion in his attempt to use ‚Äúsocial brain‚Äù concepts to guide policymaking. I cannot help but applaud any bid to use scientific evidence to back decisions for learning, business or politics in general. The way we are and how we think must be taken into account when deciding the kind of society we want ‚Äì and the good news is that it can be based on real research into who we are.;"""
"""Is it pure survival - or something far deeper? These are the types of questions asked and explored in this book on the need for human social interaction. Distinguishing humans from other mammals, Lieberman brings science to bear on why our social interactions are so critical, and what the implications are for the future of electronic connection and the era of ‚Äúbowling alone‚Äù. An interesting if somewhat difficult read.;"""
"""The book basically reviews recent brain science experiments, and how these relate to the society in which we live.  Don't let the science scare you, it is explained well.  The author makes an effort to explain the significance of the science experiments and only goes to the detail required to understand how it relates to the discussion at hand.The material will make you think and reflect.  The material has some counter intuitive punches that will reverse some of your previously conceived ideas about society.If you were to use current Canadian and US politics as representative of the state of society you might be a little cynical about societies future.  However within these pages there is some basic hope of how we are wired as humans that gives me hope, that we will overcome some of these issues in the future.One of the challenges is that the people who need to read the book won't, which is too bad, because if the science in the book is right, well that is why you need to read the book.If you care about society and where it is going, this will give you hope through scientific understanding.  If you only care about yourself, and how you can take advantage of society, you might want to read it, as you will probably discover your own worst enemy is yourself.  Ah, well poetic justice always makes for a good story.I will be reflecting on this material for sometime.  It will likely have to be read again, as while reading it the material sparked so many side trips in my wandering mind, that I had to often back track to reestablish contact with the author.  Again making it a worthwhile read.Be well, and treat each other excellently.  (Now there is scientific proof of this.);"""

"""Dei de presente para meu namorado, gamer, que amou. At√© o desempenho dele no League of Legends melhorou! Investimento maravilhoso.;"""
"""The Razer DeathAdder Essential Gaming Mouse in Mercury White has truly won me over with its outstanding performance and sleek design. As an avid gamer, I was looking for a reliable and feature-packed mouse, and this one ticks all the right boxes.Let's start with the build quality. The DeathAdder Essential boasts a robust construction that feels comfortable and durable in hand. The rubber side grips provide excellent control and prevent any slippage during intense gaming sessions. The mercury white finish adds a touch of elegance to my gaming setup, making it a visually pleasing addition.The heart of this mouse lies in its 6400 DPI optical sensor. The accuracy and precision it offers are exceptional, ensuring smooth and responsive tracking. Whether I'm engaged in fast-paced FPS battles or performing precise movements in strategy games, the sensor performs flawlessly, delivering the utmost accuracy and minimal cursor jitter.The five programmable buttons on the DeathAdder Essential are a gamer's dream come true. The customization options available through Razer Synapse software allow me to personalize the mouse according to my gaming preferences. I can assign macros, remap buttons, and create profiles for different games, giving me an edge over my opponents.One standout feature of this mouse is the integration of mechanical switches. The satisfying clicky feedback they provide adds a tactile element to my gameplay. The switches are incredibly responsive and offer a satisfying tactile feel with each press. Combined with the smooth scroll wheel, the overall responsiveness and precision make gaming an absolute joy.The software support from Razer is top-notch. The Razer Synapse software is user-friendly and offers a wide range of customization options. I can fine-tune the DPI settings, adjust the lighting effects, and even calibrate the mouse to different surfaces. The software also allows me to sync my mouse settings with other Razer devices, creating a cohesive gaming experience.In terms of value for money, the DeathAdder Essential exceeds expectations. Considering its competitive price point, it offers a remarkable set of features and performance that easily rivals more expensive gaming mice on the market.Overall, the Razer DeathAdder Essential Gaming Mouse in Mercury White is a stellar choice for gamers seeking a reliable, high-performance mouse. With its ergonomic design, customizable buttons, accurate optical sensor, and mechanical switches, it elevates my gaming experience to new heights. Razer has once again proven why they are a leader in gaming peripherals, and I have no hesitation in giving this mouse a well-deserved five-star rating.;"""
"""My razer naga (2014 model) cable frayed recently so I decided to get this mouse while I wait for the new usb lead part to arrive. The mouse is the deathadder essential but the cable is rubber instead of braided and the sides are textured plastic instead of rubber. I'm fine with that but the images are not correct and it would be nice to fix that.As for the mouse it's a good shape and works well but I find that it's not as nice feeling as the other razor products. My Big complaint is the sides are slippery since its just plastic but grip tape could help. I'm also not a fan of the deep arch in the left side but that's personal preference.Overall conclusion: it'll work if you are tight on money but If you are willing to spend a little bit more I think the deathadder v2 would be a better buy.;"""

"""Produto original, o vendedor n√£o atualizava o rastreio mas chegou no prazo e em otima qualidade.;"""
"""O mouse √© exatamente o que eu pedi veio empacotado veio amassadinho na caixa mas mouse intacto, o problema foi a entrega, demorou 3 semanas a mais do que a entrega disse que iria chegar, ou seja 1 m√™s e 3 semanas, o que deveria ter chego somente em 2 semanas e meia, acredito que seja problemas com a entrega internacional, fora isso, o produto veio de qualquer forma e √© um produto de qualidade.;"""
"""tem um desing lindo e √© bem co0nfortavel para jogos;"""
"""O mouse para as minhas necessidades ele cumpre com perfei√ß√£o, nos FPS que eu jogo ele atende como tamb√©m para trabalhos.;"""
"""Mouse do tamanho ideal para mim que tenho a m√£o grande.;"""
"""Sem defeito nenhum, cumprindo o prometido. Gosto de jogar e ele √© top;"""
"""Produto excelente, ergonomico e leve facilita o uso para jogos dando maior precis√£o no movimento;"""
"""O produto √© o que promete, muito bom, exceto pelo fiozinho de borracha...S√©rio Razer? Em pleno 2023 fiozinho de borracha? Que rasga f√°cil, quebra os fios f√°cil, que √© complicado desenrolar? Esses fios s√£o muito ruins..., n√£o esperava esse tipo de fio em um produto de qualidade.;"""
"""Mouse muito bom;"""

"""O equipamento realmente cumpre a sua fun√ß√£o e a experi√™ncia como usu√°rio tem sido a melhor poss√≠vel.;"""

"""exatamente como na imagem! √≥timo;"""

"""Simplesmente ele parou de funcionar. Achei que fosse pilhas. Troquei e n√£o funciona. gostaria de saber como podemos resolver este problema. Aguardo;"""

"""No meu computador surface conectou bem, espero continuar assim, pois os dois s√£o produtos Microsoft. N√£o √© confort√°vel de usar mas atende a necessidade de quem n√£o gosta de touch pad.;"""
"""Adorei;"""
"""Se vc tem n√£o pequena, d√™ prefer√™ncia pra outro modelo.O mouse em si √© muito bom, responde bem, as telas s√£o boas e ergon√¥micas, bem posicionadas.Ainda estou pra entender como editar os bot√µes pelo app mas uma hora eu acerto. N√£o estou muito acostumado com os bot√µes laterais do indicador, e n√£o ter m√£o t√£o grande atrapalha um pouco.A ilumina√ß√£o √© meio esquisita, n√£o tem um ""flow"" legal entre as laterais e a logo. Provavelmente por causa que s√£o 2 sistemas independentes, ex. Vc pode deixar a logo fixa em uma cor e efeitos nas laterais.;"""
"""N√£o acho o melhor mouse no sentido de custo benef√≠cio, mas definitivamente √© um dos melhores mouses que j√° usei, super confort√°vel e muito f√°cil de configurar com o iCUE. Eu que tenho pegada Claw ele se encaixou perfeitamente.;"""
"""A m√≠dia n√£o p√¥de ser carregada.
                



¬†Atendeu minhas expectativas produto top;"""
"""Mouse silencioso no geral. Firme e silencioso tamb√©m ao rolar e clicar pelo scroll. Excelente acabamento e confort√°vel de usar.Mouse anterior, Razer Mamba Wireless Chroma.;"""
"""The mouse is good for the price;"""
"""Impressions after 1 week. May update if something goes wrong later, otherwise see you in a few years.----------------------------------------------------------------------My hands measure 18 x 10 cm and I use a palm grip. Length is measured from tip of middle finger to base of palm, and width is measured from edge of pinky to edge of thumb when all fingers are placed together.I've mained 4 mice over the years, including this one. M65 RGB, M65 RGB Elite, Razer Basilisk x Hyperspeed, and this Corsair Nightsword. The original M65 RGB was a real tank that lasted me 5+ years of hard usage. The switches are still 100% responsive, but I ruined the surface coat with acetone so I upgraded to the Elite. The M65 Elite started losing responsiveness in the left click after 4 months. The Basilisk x Hyperspeed was meant to be my wireless mouse while commuting. It felt decently comfortable in store and the shape was very well done except for a slightly-off hump placement, but after a while of using it, I realized the mouse was not wide enough for my hands, which would cause some discomfort after continuous use. But for my typical not-so-heavy usage while on the go, it is acceptable. The M65/Elite (both have nearly the same form factor) has been my daily driver for nearly 6 years so I will be doing a lot of comparison with it.Now the reason I'm talking about all these other mice is so you can get other comparisons of what mice I find comfortable. Mouse shape is the most subjective and also important factor when choosing a mouse. In particular grip width matters the most. I didn't think I had massive hands but apparently I do. To this date the only other mouse that has felt comfortable to me is the Corsair M65. I've tried all sorts of mice from Logitech and Razer, that all had raving reviews, including the G502 which the Nightsword was modeled after. All of them felt extremely uncomfortable to me with poor hump placement, small grip width, uncomfortable side button positioning, etc. The Roccat Kone Aimo supposedly also has a good size for my hands, but I have yet to try it out as stores will rarely put Roccats on display.----------------------------------------------------------------------Anyways, about the actual Nightsword.Feel/Comfort:This mouse feels like it was literally made for my hands. My hand dimensions are a little unusual, even compared to other 18 x 10 cm hands, as I have very long fingers relative to my palm size. This makes it even more difficult to find a good mouse. I can't really describe the feeling when I first tried it out in store before. I have never felt this level of comfort on any mouse, not even the M65, which is pretty comfortable, but not on this level. The Nightsword has curves in all the right places, buttons at the right positions, and my hand can rest on it effortlessly without having to cramp up my palm at all. The thumb wing is extremely nice as well. The sniper button is placed right near the tip of my thumb, which is the ideal position to hit it without having to bend or stretch at all. I can easily swing my thumb up to hit the forward and back buttons above it. The DPI switches which are cut out of the left click take some more effort to hit, but I don't really use them much for now. Still figuring out the optimal way to hit them. I can actually reach one comfortably with my thumb, and the other with my index finger.Weight:This mouse is way too heavy, even with all weights removed. I have to actually consciously grip the mouse a bit harder than usual when trying to lift the mouse up, otherwise it feels like it would slip out of my hand. Combined with the high LOD on this thing, it kind of feels like Corsair doesn't intend for you to ever lift the mouse. Center of gravity adjustment is a cool idea, but it feels like a gimmick right now.Sensor:The Nightsword uses the same PMW3391 optical sensor as the M65 Elite. Now here's the thing...for some unknown reason the Nightsword falls short of the M65 Elite's performance, despite having the same sensor. People say with high end mice, the sensor isn't a spec to look at because they are all practically the same, but I disagree. I have tried many different sensors that are all in this DPI range and 1000 Hz polling rate, but nothing else has felt as as silky smooth as the M65 Elite. In fact, not even the Nightsword with the same sensor feels as smooth. It's still great performance, but after experiencing the M65 elite, something is just lacking in the smoothness.The Lift-Off Distance (LOD) is also different from the M65 Elite. It feels ridiculously high, which is bad. The M65 Elite with the exact same sensor has one of the lowest LOD's on the market, at a height of 1 DVD thickness. The Nightsword is nearly 3 DVD's in LOD, while 2 is the current industry standard. This seems to be a common issue in other reviews, so it is definitely not a one-off.----------------------------------------------------------------------Buttons:This is really one of the huge flawed areas of this mouse. It seems like corsair got all the button actuation forces backwards.* L/R click:Split trigger buttons (buttons are completely separate cutouts from the main body of the mouse) and highly sensitive. I personally dislike split trigger but some people may disagree on this. When you have split trigger buttons there is less ""springiness"" and long term feedback to the button. If you need to hold down left or right click a lot for extended periods of time, this becomes a problem. It is very easy to accidentally let go of the button when you don't have that slight feedback of the button trying to spring back against your finger. Or, over time you start to press harder and harder which is also bad. The M65 Elite which was not split trigger had the perfect amount of feedback in my opinion. Split trigger can also sometimes jam the skin of your fingers in between the button, which was a problem on the Basilisk, but so far I haven't had this issue with the Nightsword. I also find the Nightsword L/R click to be a bit too sensitive. The first few days of use, I was constantly triggering the buttons by accident just by resting my hand on it, but I've adjusted now and it no longer happens.* Scroll/Middle click:Scrolling feels pretty good. It could be a tad bit less mushy, but I can still easily scroll one tick at a time and it doesn't ever move by accident. The middle click however, has some issues. It is not as firm as it should be. Applying a slight downward force without actuating it causes it to give way a bit and create a barely-audible creaking feedback as though the scroll wheel is loose.* Sniper Button:Interestingly enough this is actually the best button on this mouse. Perfect positioning, perfect actuation force. Well done.* Forward/Back:Takes WAY too much force to press. My thumb feels like it became 3x more buff after trying to hold down macros on these buttons (seriously). Additionally, the 2 buttons sometimes get stuck on each other. Press one, and it pushes on the other one, or sometimes even catches on the other when trying to release (you hear 2 ""clicks"" as the button tries to come back up). They are also slightly wobbly.* Profile Shift:Not too much to say about these except that they should be less sensitive. You'd think that they're pretty out of the way, but I have actually swapped profiles by accident a couple of times already. When flipping the mouse over to try out the weight system, they would constantly keep triggering just from the weight of the mouse.* DPI Shift:These have the same sensitivity as the L/R click, so I have the same opinion on that. The main thing about these is the shape. I understand that the intention was to keep the contour of the left click intact, but I would have liked to see the DPI-down button raised slightly higher so that it can be hit by rolling the index finger, without hitting the other buttons around it by accident.----------------------------------------------------------------------Build/Materials:I really like the left and right click material a lot on this mouse. Feels like a really high quality matte plastic and repels dirt really well. The glossy plastic on the side buttons gunks up extremely quickly and I don't even have sweaty or oily hands. The rubberized material on the rest of the mouse seems alright for now but it seems like it could deteriorate very quickly if you tried to scrub it for any cleaning. The textured surface seems to just be asking for gunk to get stuffed in the holes and be impossible to clean. We'll see. Scroll wheel and Forward/Back buttons could be less wobbly as I described before but otherwise build quality is very good.----------------------------------------------------------------------Final comments for Corsair:I really want to see you guys combine all the best things into one mouse. The form factor of the Nightsword + the M65 Elite's sensor, button build quality, material, and button actuation forces + optical switches (a lot of left/right click problems with many of your recent mice) + less weight, and maybe wireless. That would be my dream mouse.;"""
"""I bough this to replace my last Corsair mouse and I think it is the best mouse for the money. its got a bit of a goofy thumb rest, but the rest of the design is top notch;"""
"""Me gust√≥ mucho lo solido y pesado que se siente al colocar todos los pesos, funciona excelente y se  e resistente y duradero, lo unico que no me gust√≥ mucho es que el boton sniper me queda un poco fuera de mi posici√≥n del dedo gordo y eso que tengo manos y dedos largos y grandes. De ah√≠  en mas todo funciona muy bien y me agrada bastante como se juega con √©l;"""
"""I love the overall look and design of this mouse, I love the layout of the side buttons, I love the customization options, but I have three major problems with it. First the switch for the right click seems to have only half as much travel as the left click, and as a result is incredibly easy to accidentally click, I find it happening quite often from just operating the scroll wheel as my middle finger slightly pulls on my index finger as i flick the wheel, and that slight involuntary movement is enough to activate the right click. My second problem is closely related to the last one; the finger channel on the right click button pushes my fingers so close together that they are rubbing on one another and in the way of eachother, forcing me to rest my index finger on the raised edge of the channel further increasing accidental clicks. My third issue is the way the mouse slides across surfaces. Prior to this I was using a no name $30 ergo mouse, and that thing felt smooth as glass compared to this. It just feels and sounds abrasive, like it's being dragged instead of slid, at first I thought I must've forgotten to peel some film off the pads but after picking at them for a few minutes I was at a loss.I'm gonna try to get used to it and see it it doesn't get better, other reviews said this was a good mouse for people with large hands, the narrow finger channels kind of hamper that, at least if you use 3 fingers.;"""
"""I love the thumb rest. It feels so nice in the hand too.;"""
"""Se vc tem n√£o pequena, d√™ prefer√™ncia pra outro modelo.O mouse em si √© muito bom, responde bem, as telas s√£o boas e ergon√¥micas, bem posicionadas.Ainda estou pra entender como editar os bot√µes pelo app mas uma hora eu acerto. N√£o estou muito acostumado com os bot√µes laterais do indicador, e n√£o ter m√£o t√£o grande atrapalha um pouco.A ilumina√ß√£o √© meio esquisita, n√£o tem um ""flow"" legal entre as laterais e a logo. Provavelmente por causa que s√£o 2 sistemas independentes, ex. Vc pode deixar a logo fixa em uma cor e efeitos nas laterais.;"""
"""N√£o acho o melhor mouse no sentido de custo benef√≠cio, mas definitivamente √© um dos melhores mouses que j√° usei, super confort√°vel e muito f√°cil de configurar com o iCUE. Eu que tenho pegada Claw ele se encaixou perfeitamente.;"""
"""A m√≠dia n√£o p√¥de ser carregada.
                



¬†Atendeu minhas expectativas produto top;"""
"""Mouse silencioso no geral. Firme e silencioso tamb√©m ao rolar e clicar pelo scroll. Excelente acabamento e confort√°vel de usar.Mouse anterior, Razer Mamba Wireless Chroma.;"""
"""The mouse is good for the price;"""
"""Impressions after 1 week. May update if something goes wrong later, otherwise see you in a few years.----------------------------------------------------------------------My hands measure 18 x 10 cm and I use a palm grip. Length is measured from tip of middle finger to base of palm, and width is measured from edge of pinky to edge of thumb when all fingers are placed together.I've mained 4 mice over the years, including this one. M65 RGB, M65 RGB Elite, Razer Basilisk x Hyperspeed, and this Corsair Nightsword. The original M65 RGB was a real tank that lasted me 5+ years of hard usage. The switches are still 100% responsive, but I ruined the surface coat with acetone so I upgraded to the Elite. The M65 Elite started losing responsiveness in the left click after 4 months. The Basilisk x Hyperspeed was meant to be my wireless mouse while commuting. It felt decently comfortable in store and the shape was very well done except for a slightly-off hump placement, but after a while of using it, I realized the mouse was not wide enough for my hands, which would cause some discomfort after continuous use. But for my typical not-so-heavy usage while on the go, it is acceptable. The M65/Elite (both have nearly the same form factor) has been my daily driver for nearly 6 years so I will be doing a lot of comparison with it.Now the reason I'm talking about all these other mice is so you can get other comparisons of what mice I find comfortable. Mouse shape is the most subjective and also important factor when choosing a mouse. In particular grip width matters the most. I didn't think I had massive hands but apparently I do. To this date the only other mouse that has felt comfortable to me is the Corsair M65. I've tried all sorts of mice from Logitech and Razer, that all had raving reviews, including the G502 which the Nightsword was modeled after. All of them felt extremely uncomfortable to me with poor hump placement, small grip width, uncomfortable side button positioning, etc. The Roccat Kone Aimo supposedly also has a good size for my hands, but I have yet to try it out as stores will rarely put Roccats on display.----------------------------------------------------------------------Anyways, about the actual Nightsword.Feel/Comfort:This mouse feels like it was literally made for my hands. My hand dimensions are a little unusual, even compared to other 18 x 10 cm hands, as I have very long fingers relative to my palm size. This makes it even more difficult to find a good mouse. I can't really describe the feeling when I first tried it out in store before. I have never felt this level of comfort on any mouse, not even the M65, which is pretty comfortable, but not on this level. The Nightsword has curves in all the right places, buttons at the right positions, and my hand can rest on it effortlessly without having to cramp up my palm at all. The thumb wing is extremely nice as well. The sniper button is placed right near the tip of my thumb, which is the ideal position to hit it without having to bend or stretch at all. I can easily swing my thumb up to hit the forward and back buttons above it. The DPI switches which are cut out of the left click take some more effort to hit, but I don't really use them much for now. Still figuring out the optimal way to hit them. I can actually reach one comfortably with my thumb, and the other with my index finger.Weight:This mouse is way too heavy, even with all weights removed. I have to actually consciously grip the mouse a bit harder than usual when trying to lift the mouse up, otherwise it feels like it would slip out of my hand. Combined with the high LOD on this thing, it kind of feels like Corsair doesn't intend for you to ever lift the mouse. Center of gravity adjustment is a cool idea, but it feels like a gimmick right now.Sensor:The Nightsword uses the same PMW3391 optical sensor as the M65 Elite. Now here's the thing...for some unknown reason the Nightsword falls short of the M65 Elite's performance, despite having the same sensor. People say with high end mice, the sensor isn't a spec to look at because they are all practically the same, but I disagree. I have tried many different sensors that are all in this DPI range and 1000 Hz polling rate, but nothing else has felt as as silky smooth as the M65 Elite. In fact, not even the Nightsword with the same sensor feels as smooth. It's still great performance, but after experiencing the M65 elite, something is just lacking in the smoothness.The Lift-Off Distance (LOD) is also different from the M65 Elite. It feels ridiculously high, which is bad. The M65 Elite with the exact same sensor has one of the lowest LOD's on the market, at a height of 1 DVD thickness. The Nightsword is nearly 3 DVD's in LOD, while 2 is the current industry standard. This seems to be a common issue in other reviews, so it is definitely not a one-off.----------------------------------------------------------------------Buttons:This is really one of the huge flawed areas of this mouse. It seems like corsair got all the button actuation forces backwards.* L/R click:Split trigger buttons (buttons are completely separate cutouts from the main body of the mouse) and highly sensitive. I personally dislike split trigger but some people may disagree on this. When you have split trigger buttons there is less ""springiness"" and long term feedback to the button. If you need to hold down left or right click a lot for extended periods of time, this becomes a problem. It is very easy to accidentally let go of the button when you don't have that slight feedback of the button trying to spring back against your finger. Or, over time you start to press harder and harder which is also bad. The M65 Elite which was not split trigger had the perfect amount of feedback in my opinion. Split trigger can also sometimes jam the skin of your fingers in between the button, which was a problem on the Basilisk, but so far I haven't had this issue with the Nightsword. I also find the Nightsword L/R click to be a bit too sensitive. The first few days of use, I was constantly triggering the buttons by accident just by resting my hand on it, but I've adjusted now and it no longer happens.* Scroll/Middle click:Scrolling feels pretty good. It could be a tad bit less mushy, but I can still easily scroll one tick at a time and it doesn't ever move by accident. The middle click however, has some issues. It is not as firm as it should be. Applying a slight downward force without actuating it causes it to give way a bit and create a barely-audible creaking feedback as though the scroll wheel is loose.* Sniper Button:Interestingly enough this is actually the best button on this mouse. Perfect positioning, perfect actuation force. Well done.* Forward/Back:Takes WAY too much force to press. My thumb feels like it became 3x more buff after trying to hold down macros on these buttons (seriously). Additionally, the 2 buttons sometimes get stuck on each other. Press one, and it pushes on the other one, or sometimes even catches on the other when trying to release (you hear 2 ""clicks"" as the button tries to come back up). They are also slightly wobbly.* Profile Shift:Not too much to say about these except that they should be less sensitive. You'd think that they're pretty out of the way, but I have actually swapped profiles by accident a couple of times already. When flipping the mouse over to try out the weight system, they would constantly keep triggering just from the weight of the mouse.* DPI Shift:These have the same sensitivity as the L/R click, so I have the same opinion on that. The main thing about these is the shape. I understand that the intention was to keep the contour of the left click intact, but I would have liked to see the DPI-down button raised slightly higher so that it can be hit by rolling the index finger, without hitting the other buttons around it by accident.----------------------------------------------------------------------Build/Materials:I really like the left and right click material a lot on this mouse. Feels like a really high quality matte plastic and repels dirt really well. The glossy plastic on the side buttons gunks up extremely quickly and I don't even have sweaty or oily hands. The rubberized material on the rest of the mouse seems alright for now but it seems like it could deteriorate very quickly if you tried to scrub it for any cleaning. The textured surface seems to just be asking for gunk to get stuffed in the holes and be impossible to clean. We'll see. Scroll wheel and Forward/Back buttons could be less wobbly as I described before but otherwise build quality is very good.----------------------------------------------------------------------Final comments for Corsair:I really want to see you guys combine all the best things into one mouse. The form factor of the Nightsword + the M65 Elite's sensor, button build quality, material, and button actuation forces + optical switches (a lot of left/right click problems with many of your recent mice) + less weight, and maybe wireless. That would be my dream mouse.;"""
"""I bough this to replace my last Corsair mouse and I think it is the best mouse for the money. its got a bit of a goofy thumb rest, but the rest of the design is top notch;"""

De ah√≠  en mas todo funciona muy bien y me agrada bastante como se juega con √©l;"""
"""I love the overall look and design of this mouse, I love the layout of the side buttons, I love the customization options, but I have three major problems with it. First the switch for the right click seems to have only half as much travel as the left click, and as a result is incredibly easy to accidentally click, I find it happening quite often from just operating the scroll wheel as my middle finger slightly pulls on my index finger as i flick the wheel, and that slight involuntary movement is enough to activate the right click. My second problem is closely related to the last one; the finger channel on the right click button pushes my fingers so close together that they are rubbing on one another and in the way of eachother, forcing me to rest my index finger on the raised edge of the channel further increasing accidental clicks. My third issue is the way the mouse slides across surfaces. Prior to this I was using a no name $30 ergo mouse, and that thing felt smooth as glass compared to this. It just feels and sounds abrasive, like it's being dragged instead of slid, at first I thought I must've forgotten to peel some film off the pads but after picking at them for a few minutes I was at a loss.I'm gonna try to get used to it and see it it doesn't get better, other reviews said this was a good mouse for people with large hands, the narrow finger channels kind of hamper that, at least if you use 3 fingers.;"""

"""√ìtimo mouse, recomendo;"""
"""redragon sempre me impecavel;"""
"""Em rela√ß√£o a custo beneficio, design e qualidade n√£o tenho nada a reclamar, por√©m sinto falta de aten√ß√£o por parte da Redragon em rela√ß√£o ao software do mouse, mesmo ele tendo capacidade para muitas cores no LED, tem possibilidade de apenas 7 cores no programa, e pouqu√≠ssimos estilos de ""dan√ßas"" do LED, al√©m dele ser muito bugado, as vezes quando eu ligo o PC o programa n√£o inicia no mesmo perfil que eu deixei, e ao trocar de usu√°rio (no windows), o programa simplesmente deixa de funcionar, mas em rela√ß√£o h√° liberdade de sensibilidade, macros e DPI n√£o se tem do que reclamar. O an√∫ncio estava diferente do que realmente veio, no anuncio diz 10.000 de DPI, o que veio foi de 12.400, mas n√£o tenho do que reclamar rs, chegou dentro do prazo inicial esperado e veio em perfeito estado, estou usando h√° uma semana e n√£o me arrependo de ter comprado.;"""
"""Um √≥timo mouse, bastante confort√°vel e preciso, principalmente para jogos.;"""

¬†***Vorwort***Mittlerweile bin ich ziemlich skeptisch, was K√§ufe von Logitech-Hardware dank st√§ndiger Probleme mit Ausf√§llen anbelangt‚Ä¶hier seien besonders die Maustypen ‚ÄûG602‚Äú, ‚ÄûMX Master 2s‚Äú oder auch die ‚ÄûM705 Marathon‚Äú erw√§hnt.Kommen wir nun aber mal auf die ‚ÄûG502 Lightspeed‚Äú zu sprechen, bei der ich ‚Äì trotz des hohen Preises ‚Äì nicht widerstehen konnte, da mir das Ur-Model, die ‚ÄûLogitech Proteus Core‚Äú (ohne Spectrum!) √ºber einen langen Zeitraum ein treuer ‚Äì und ganz wichtig ‚Äì robuster Begleiter war.In all der Zeit ging mir daran nie etwas defekt, weder eine der Tasten, noch kam es zum Kabelbruch, noch war das Seitengummi abgenutzt. Da ich gerne auf eine kabellose Variante wechseln wollte, wurde sie allerdings dann irgendwann von mir ausgemustert, mittlerweile nutzt sie ein Bekannter und sie arbeitet noch immer perfekt.Nachdem ich gesehen hatte, dass es inzwischen die ‚Äûkabellose‚Äú Variante der G502 gibt und mir die fehlende Rechtsh√§nder-Ergonomie der G903 einfach nicht gef√§llt, hab ich mir die ‚ÄûLightspeed‚Äú kurzerhand im November 2019 per Warehouse-Deal in der 20%-Aktion bestellt und hier nun meine Eindr√ºcke und bisherigen Erfahrungen:***Verpackungsinhalt und Verarbeitung***Zur Verpackung muss ich sagen: ‚Äûein Traum‚Äú! :)Im Gegensatz zur letzten Maus (M705 Marathon) kein ‚Äûschneide-mich-auf-Plastik‚Äú sondern eine ordentliche Verpackung wie bsplw. bei der ebenfalls hochpreisigen G903, welche die Maus auch angemessen in Szene setzt.Nun, was findet man denn jetzt genau in dem kleinen Verpackungskarton?- G502 Lightspeed- USB-Ladekabel- Bedienheft- Warranty-Heftchen- ‚ÄûLogitech sagt Danke‚Äú-K√§rtchen- G-Aufkleber- kleines Plastik-K√§stchen mit Inhalt (dazu unten mehr)Die ‚ÄûLightspeed‚Äú ist verarbeitungstechnisch nicht anders als die von mir urspr√ºnglich genutzte G502 ‚ÄûProteus Core‚Äú, √§u√üerlich hat sich nicht wirklich etwas am Design ge√§ndert, lediglich der Sensor ist nun deutlich besser, sie ist nun endlich ‚Äûwireless‚Äú (Ein-/Ausschalter auf der Unterseite), es gibt eine RGB-Beleuchtung und die Powerplay-Funktion wurde eingef√ºhrt.Nichts an der Maus klappert, die Raster- und Freilauffunktion des Mausrads funktioniert einwandfrei, die Seitengummierung f√ºhlt sich ebenfalls sehr angenehm an, lediglich das Mausrad ist (leider) noch so laut, wie beim mir bekannten ‚ÄûUr-Typ‚Äú der G502. Die Abdeckung f√ºr die Gewichte auf der Unterseite der Maus ist unver√§ndert magnetisch geblieben, die Magnetkraft ist angenehm stark.In Bezug auf das USB-Ladekabel gibt es nichts gro√üartig zu bemerken, au√üer dass es sich um kein USB-C Kabel handelt und dass es schwarz ummantelt ist. An der Stelle sei erw√§hnt, dass mir die originalen Logitech-Ladekabel bisher tats√§chlich nie defekt gegangen sind.Das Bedienheftchen enth√§lt die n√∂tigsten Informationen √ºber kleine Schaubilder, die G-Tasten werden ebenfalls kurz erkl√§rt, wobei man sich diese sp√§ter auf Wunsch √ºber die Software (Logitech G-Hub) nat√ºrlich wunschgem√§√ü belegen kann.Kommentare zum Warranty-Heftchen und Danksagungs-K√§rtchen spare ich mir an der Stelle mal, der G-Aufkleber ist eine nette kleine Zugabe, hin kleben werde ich ihn mir jedoch nirgends. :)Kommen wir nun zu dem kleinen Plastik-K√§stchen, welches ein ‚ÄûG‚Äú-Symbol tr√§gt und in schwarz gehalten ist. √ñffnet man dieses nun, findet man insgesamt 6 Gewichte vor, n√§mlich 4x 2g und 2x 4g (hierzu weiter unten mehr), den USB-Funkempf√§nger sowie einen passenden Verl√§ngerungsadapter.***Erfahrungen***Die ‚ÄûG502 Lightspeed‚Äú bietet Nutzern des ‚ÄûPowerplay‚Äú-Mauspads den Vorteil, dass sie nicht manuell aufgeladen werden muss, stattdessen wird sie bei Nutzung des besagten Mauspads ‚Äûpermanent‚Äú geladen. Als bisheriger Nutzer des Mauspads in Kombination mit der G903 kann ich an der Stelle keine direkte Erfahrung schildern, wie lange nun der Akku ohne das Powerplay-Mauspad im Betrieb h√§lt, da ich die Maus ‚Äûgr√∂√ütenteils‚Äú auf dem Pad nutze. Die Powerplay-Funktion ist einwandfrei gegeben, Ladekabel und auch Empf√§nger werden in dieser Kombination gar nicht erst ben√∂tigt.Allerdings habe ich die Maus testweise mal an einem normalen Arbeitstag (8 Stunden) an einem Zweitrechner betrieben (ohne Powerplay) und es gab auch bei der Nutzung mit dem beiliegenden USB-Empf√§nger keinerlei Probleme (Aussetzer o.√§.) im Betrieb, der Akku nahm nur einige Prozent in der Leistung ab. Also sollte die vom Hersteller angegebene Akkulaufzeit durchaus erreichbar sein (abh√§ngig von der RGB-Beleuchtung!).Die Verbindung mit dem Powerplay-Mauspad ist recht einfach herzustellen, jedoch muss man bedenken, nutzt man dieses, kann man nur maximal die ‚Äû4x 2g‚Äú Gewichte einlegen, da dann der Chip f√ºr das Powerplay-Mauspad auf der Unterseite der Maus eingesetzt werden muss (s. Video), an dieser Stelle kommen eigentlich die 2x 4g Gewichte zum Einsatz. Schade aber war wohl nicht anders machbar.Die Software ‚ÄûLogitech G-Hub‚Äú bietet alle notwendigen Funktionen zum individuellen Einrichten der G-Tasten, ich pers√∂nlich nutze aber bis auf eine kleine √Ñnderung der RGB-Beleuchtung die Maus im Auslieferungszustand, da mir die Tastenbelegung so schon zusagt.Die Lightspeed ist ergonomisch f√ºr Rechtsh√§nder geformt, somit im Normalfall nicht f√ºr Linksh√§nder geeignet, sie liegt - f√ºr diejenigen, die das Modell ‚ÄûG502‚Äú noch gar nicht kennen ‚Äì sehr angenehm in der Hand, man verkrampft sich nicht und kann sehr sch√∂n damit arbeiten / zocken.Das Mausrad funktioniert sowohl mit ‚ÄûRasterfunktion‚Äú als auch im ‚ÄûFreilauf‚Äú sehr gut, lediglich die Lautst√§rke im ‚ÄûRasterbetrieb‚Äú h√§tte seitens Logitech auch noch √ºberarbeitet werden k√∂nnen, leider ist die Lightspeed hier genauso laut wie die Proteus Core. Schade.Die im Video angesprochene Aiming-Taste habe ich lustigerweise beim ‚ÄûUr-Typ‚Äú nie in der voreingestellten Funktion genutzt, mittlerweile finde ich aber gerade diese sehr hilfreich, da ich dahinter gekommen bin, dass man damit ‚Äûgenaue‚Äú Arbeiten mit dem Mauszeiger durchf√ºhren kann. Dr√ºckt man die Taste, schaltet sich der Mauszeiger bei Bewegung auf 400DPI runter und man kann bsplw. bei Ego-Shootern ruhiger zielen oder in Programmen (Bildbearbeitung usw.) schlichtweg genauer arbeiten.***Fazit***Eigentlich wollte ich so schnell keine Logitech-Maus mehr, der Preis f√ºr die G502 Lightspeed (und auch MX Master 3) ist noch immer zu hoch! """Man ist ja diese Gaming-Maus schon als Kabelvariante gewohnt und gilt nicht ohne Grund zu einer der besten Gaming-M√§use. """I am so far, very happy to say I am very happy to have this new machine!1. Received it Feb 27th, 2023. Earlier than expected delivery date.  Started using the morning of Feb 28th.2. It was not a repackaged used machine that slipped through the cracks like it appeared to have in so many of the recent comments!!!!!  Thinking wherever those people are that got a repackaged used machine, must be serviced by an Amazon facility that has employees that don't care!!!  To them, if they read this, always let Amazon know!!!3. I drink MEDAGLIA D'ORO, which is Espresso Italian Roast ground coffee.  For that, cannot use the screen filter that comes with the machine.  Need to use the #4 filters which fit perfectly.4. Have not tried the Espresso side yet, but performing the initial setup per the instructions, everything worked beautifully and easily.  There were no leaks.5.  I place the machine on two layers of paper towels (4 sheets, folded in half) which fit the footprint of the machine almost perfectly. In other words, the footprint on the machine fits inside 2 sheets of Bounty paper towels.USING THE COFFFEE SIDE:One of the first things I noticed is the design of the Carafe. Either it needs an improved design, or the current design is to prevent any coffee grind sludge, that made it down from the drip, from pouring into your coffee cup/mug/tumbler.  There is about a teaspoon or less, that cannot be poured out.I use the Bold enabled button and seems to work well for boosting the flavor of the coffee.The touch buttons are a nice touch... no brute force needed for turning any knobs or pressing actual buttons... fewer moving parts means fewer mechanical failures.I set the clock on the machine on Thursday, March 2nd, and today, March 4th, I noticed it was a minute behind already.  Not a real bad thing, as it is easier to set the clock forward a few minutes due to it being slightly slow, than resetting the time back because it runs to fast.As for the filter and the reservoir for the coffee side, I wish the reservoir was removable like it is for the espresso side. Making it easier to clean than.  And as for the filter, I'll need to try and keep track of when that needs to be changed. Meaning have to set some reminder someplace ""Check coffee reservoir filter to replace"", gee... as if there aren't enough other reminders in life to list and keep track of!!! LOLI have not changed the default time for the warmer to turn off, as I am turning off the machine after the coffee is done dripping.OH... something I didn't see mentioned is... The machine has a BEEP (not loud) when done with the dripping.  That is a nice touch if you are still in proximity to the machine.  I like that as a reminder!!!That's it for now... will update later if and when I remember to.;"""
"""I‚Äôve wanted an espresso machine for awhile since buying lattes every morning is expensive. """I have waited to write a review because I wanted to use it for a few months first. I received this for Christmas, but I also picked this one out for my husband to get me. I read all the reviews about the leaking, noise, the length of time it takes and the frother. I also read all the great reviews. I decided out of all the machines out there, this one seemed to be the one that would most likely work in our kitchen and for our lattes.After using this machine for 3 months I can confirm it is noisy, but so are the ones at the coffee houses and it really does not bother me at all. If you are an earlier riser and you family will be annoyed with you for making your espresso or latte in the morning this may not be the right one for you. Does it leak. NO it does not leak. These people who say it leaks must be the laziest people on the planet. It will only leak if you do not remove water from the bottom where your cup sits. I also always dump the water after I am done making my coffee. It takes a while to warm up. If the light turns to a steady light before 5 mins it is not ready. For sure give it 5-10 mins to heat up. The frother works great if you heat up your cold milk first in the microwave just for a min. Otherwise it does take a little while. The foam is perfect. I bought a coffee grinder from XO and grinds the beans to the perfect espresso powder. The coffee tastes great. The coffee maker works great too. If you want a faster machine you will need to spend a $1000-$2000 for sure. I was not willing to do that since I still like to go to my local Starbucks.I am completely satisfied with this machine. My kids love it too.;"""

"""Color : BlackSize : Large (believe it was previously named small)P r o s :-Adjustable padded straps.-The waist belt is nice for extended periods of walking.-Comfortable on my back. Some padding in the back. With a nice hidden area for items like your wallet.-Good at keeping things organized because it has lots of pockets-Lots of space inside the bag.-Nice material. I spilled some latte on it and it cleaned up easily. Everything inside stayed dry.-I like the shape. It's square. Not floppy.-It flattens down and stores well.C o n s :-The shoe pocket takes up space inside the main compartment. Which is a little annoying. But I like the idea of having a separate compartment for shoes to not dirty your clothes.-Water bottle pocket fits my size 18 oz hydro flask. My water bottle has a sleeve strap around the base. It was tricky sliding it into the pocket and I think the pocket could be bigger. The side pocket might be able to fit 22 oz but any bigger might be impossible to fit.O v e r a l l :I used this for a weekend road trip. It was the best bag I've ever used for travel. When I needed something it was nice to have easy access to everything. The trip was overnight to a location with warm weather. I had extra space in the bag. Since I had the space it was excellent tightening the straps to slim the backpack. You might be able to pack for about 2 to 3 days depending on how much you're packing and the climate.If you limit what you pack this would probably be good for a personal item on a plane. Be sure to measure it first and compare it with your airline's requirements. I can't wait to try it out on the plane. It has a strap to connect to a rolling suitcase. And I think it will work well with my packing cubes.My least favorite thing about this bad is that the shoe compartment makes it bulge and takes space from the main clothes pocket. And I wish the water bottle holder was bigger but I like that it flattens when it's empty.I've been pretty happy with it. I feel like this bag is the perfect travel bag for me!;"""
"""Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. All the pockets are extremely tight. I struggled to wedge my laptop into this bag and one of the corners still sticks out. It fits decently in the main compartment but not in the laptop section.The mesh bottle pockets are also extremely small. I think this bag was more designed to fit under a seat and everything you put on it just gets crushed to fit the dimensions. I had to get extremely creative to fit the few items I have in it.The shoe compartment is useless as it takes up the already limited space inside the main compartment. The pocket on the back is also very tight and shallow. I could fit either my phone or my wallet, but not both.I feel like I was a little misled by the tiktok reviews that got me to purchase this. I was made to believe you could fit a laptop and a couple days worth of clothes plus shoes and toiletries plus a phone and wallet and keys or meds..... this bag barely fits my laptop, switch, one RX bottle, a box of ibuprofen and my headphones.Good things about the bag :I like the strap on the back to hold your bag to a roller suitcase. Definitely helped save my back.The power bank port is nice. I have a larger power bank and that did not help my case with the lack of space, but being able to plug into the exterior of my bag instead of digging around for the bank at the bottom of my bag to use it was nice.The wet pocket is cool. I can shove my wet wipes and eyedrops in there without worrying of spillage. However I think that pocket is much larger than it needed to be.Overall it's a good bag. Just don't expect it to replace your carry on.;"""
"""La compre para mi novia y por fin, ya no tenemos que documentar, tiene un buen volumen para un par de d√≠as en la playa y evitar documentaci√≥n.  Tambi√©n espacio para laptop o tablet. La compre por menos de $700mxp el precio var√≠a con las temporadas.;"""

"""Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. All the pockets are extremely tight. I struggled to wedge my laptop into this bag and one of the corners still sticks out. It fits decently in the main compartment but not in the laptop section.The mesh bottle pockets are also extremely small. I think this bag was more designed to fit under a seat and everything you put on it just gets crushed to fit the dimensions. I had to get extremely creative to fit the few items I have in it.The shoe compartment is useless as it takes up the already limited space inside the main compartment. The pocket on the back is also very tight and shallow. I could fit either my phone or my wallet, but not both.I feel like I was a little misled by the tiktok reviews that got me to purchase this. I was made to believe you could fit a laptop and a couple days worth of clothes plus shoes and toiletries plus a phone and wallet and keys or meds..... this bag barely fits my laptop, switch, one RX bottle, a box of ibuprofen and my headphones.Good things about the bag :I like the strap on the back to hold your bag to a roller suitcase. Definitely helped save my back.The power bank port is nice. I have a larger power bank and that did not help my case with the lack of space, but being able to plug into the exterior of my bag instead of digging around for the bank at the bottom of my bag to use it was nice.The wet pocket is cool. I can shove my wet wipes and eyedrops in there without worrying of spillage. However I think that pocket is much larger than it needed to be.Overall it's a good bag. Just don't expect it to replace your carry on.;"""

"""Still a great bag, but I feel like my old traditional style back pack had a lot more room in it. This one has tons of different pockets, but you can't actually fit very much into them. """Firstly, these jeans are made in china and are not Motherhood. I think it's important for Amazon to state this as what is advertised is not what you get.I ordered two pairs to see which would be the best fit. The larger size arrived first. I waited and waited but they never came and the return period for the larger size expired.So I have a pair of these jeans that are a bit big for me. They're made well but I find the 'over bump' top of the jeans rolls down so I am constantly pulling them up.Overall I am disappointed with the product but mainly in their marketing than the product. """El pantal√≥n es s√∫per c√≥modo y buen agarre en la parte de la mezclilla aunque mancha un poco los art√≠culos que colocas en las bolsas y la piel.. ya lo lav√© varias veces y sigue manchando.. fuera de eso todo bien;"""
"""I really like these jeans but the sizing is off. I bought both the small and medium to compare and see which which sizing felt best to me. I'm a size 4 prepregnancy and according to the chart should be a small but am generally between sizes so ordered both just in case, and I'm glad I did. The jeans are stretchy and I like the medium wash but the small pair I received is bigger than the medium pair. (See photos) The colors are slightly different too with the medium being a bit lighter than the small but not a big difference. I tried on the medium first and was surprised to see they felt a bit tight (still wearable but tighter than I would have thought/preferred). I wasn't even going to bother trying on the small but realized the small looked bigger than the medium so tried on and they felt similar but a bit loser than the medium. I then measured them because I thought that was odd and sure enough the small is bigger. I double checked the tags inside and the sizing is correct and the styles are identical so not sure what happened. Length fits me great - I'm 5'2'' and debated ordering petite but glad I ordered the regular instead. I wanted to purchase another pair in a different color as well but can't due to not knowing wht size to order!;"""
"""For $18 I am thrilled with these maternity pants! I‚Äôm just approaching 20 weeks and my bump finally started to pop. I‚Äôm not someone who wears jeans a lot, but figured I needed at least one pair to get through the rest of winter and spring. Still, I couldn‚Äôt imagine spending $40-$50 on jeans I would only wear a handful of times. These fit the bill!The belly band part is extremely comfortable- snug enough to fit me now with just a tiny bump but with plenty of room to grow with me! Im folding the belly band in half in the meantime and it seems to work great! """These jeans are ok, but beware if you are tall! I'm 5'8 and they land above my ankle so not true ""skinny jeans"" that you could tuck into low boots but fine for tennis shoes or rolling up. """One of the most annoying things about maternity pants is that some mediums are HUGE and some are very small. These are smaller than I expected. I‚Äôm hoping they stretch out a bit after extended wearing, then I can maintain them by washing on cool.;"""
"""The GoodI really do like the fact that these jeans look like regular pants, my husband didn't even notice they were maternity jeans until he saw me taking them off several weeks later. """Avalia√ß√£o geral:Comprei este telado bluetooth para livrar as portas USB do meu computador e me surpreendi com sua responsividade r√°pida. """Eu estava de olho nesse teclado h√° muito tempo. Logitech √© uma boa marca e dos produtos que tenho, nunca tive problemas. As teclas s√£o arredondadas e, por isso, tem um charme. 5 principais fatores me chamaram a aten√ß√£o quando decidi comprar (fatores positivos e negativos), sem incluir o pre√ßo, porque estava um pouco mais barato que o normal (160 reais).1) O tamanho. √â pequeno, pequeno mesmo. Haviam poucas fotos dessa cor especificamente quando comprei, por isso anexei mais algumas. √â um cinza claro, bem neutro e elegante. Fica muito bonito em contraste com a mesa preta ou branca.4) Teclas silenciosas. Esse foi um ponto levemente negativo para mim, que amo o barulho do teclado. Diria que a sensa√ß√£o de teclar √© bem parecida com o teclado embutido de um notebook, teclas baixas e silenciosas. Para a maioria das pessoas, esse √© um fator super positivo, mas vale a pena ser mencionado.5) O padr√£o internacional. Esse √© o maior problema desse teclado. N√£o tem abnt2, que √© o padr√£o usado pelo Brasil. Isso significa que as teclas est√£o em posi√ß√µes diferentes do que a maioria dos teclados que usamos. √â estranho, mas facilmente adapt√°vel. Quando usei pela primeira vez, fiquei confusa porque as teclas n√£o estavam correspondendo com os simbolos que sa√≠am. Logo percebi que como meu computador estava configurado em abnt2, mesmo que a tecla n√£o mostrasse um '""√ß"" por exemplo, se eu apertasse a tecla que geralmente seria o ""√ß"" em um teclado brasileiro, a letra sa√≠a. """Produto conforme anuncio, muito bom e original.;"""
"""Bom;"""
"""A c√¢mera √© pequena, ocupando pouco espa√ßo na bolsa.A bateria dura bastante tempo.As fotos ficam √≥timas.Vendedor muito atencioso.;"""
"""Produto de qualidade!;"""
"""DISLIKES:  No external charger for the battery.  Most digital cameras I have purchased in the past always came with an external charger.  This one only charges the battery internally, unless you buy an external charger, which I would highly recommend one always have an external charger for extra/spare batteries for your camera!  Also didn't like you only access the manual by reading or downloading on-line.  What is wrong with manufacturers today?  They SHOULD supply manuals with their products, no matter what it is.  Not have the end user go hunting for it, and many times when I went seeking a manual for a product I bought, if the manufacturer may have discontinued the item, they tend to remove the manual, and now it's no longer available to access, even though you may have bought the item new, no manual with it is just dumb and lazy on their part.  If I am printing it on paper, then they sure didn't save any trees, and maybe I had to print it several times before I got the fomatting right to put it in a notebook or folder for future reference, wasting paper and more trees.  Manufactures take notice, you ARE NOT doing the trees or the end user any favor by EXCLUDING manuals from your products!LIKES:  Easy to use, but then I have been accustomed to digital cameras for a very long time, so I can navigate around them very easily, and I found this one very easy to navigateonce I checked out all the buttons and what they did.  Has a nice LCD screen for viewing your photo's after taking the shots, one thing I don't quite understand is the ""slideshow"", you get 3 options to pick from #1, #2 or #3,  #1 just shows the basic snapshot and really does nothing.  #2 will do some type of effect, as does #3, but to me, they make no rhyme or reason for even being there at all.They don't copy to your computer when transferring the photo's to your computer, you'd have to use another program, like some kind of video editor to create a slide show with similar or like effects.  And the issue is, it's NOT a slide show of the photo's in the camera or on the SD Card, it only affects the ONE PHOTO you're viewing, so it's not a slideshow by any means.  When I selected it to see what it did, it just affected the one photo I was viewing, I had expected to see a slideshow of ALL the photo's I had taken or be allowed to select a specific number to create a slideshow that could be saved as a video exported file from the camera, but none of that is possible.  Waste of a camera resource in my opinion.The photos are good, and I have attached a few here to show the cameras' capability in low light conditions, the two photo's of the same kitten (Cordellia-001/-002) are indoors in low light, the older cat (Apollo), taken outside is nearing sunset.  Forgive the messy look of the floor inside the house, we're in the process of removing the carpeting from our house, and we're just starting work on it, so the floors look a tad messy for the time being.Even with the Dislikes and the few faults it has, I can recommend the camera, it seems to take nice photographs, I haven't tried videos as yet, I have some projects in mind for that for YouTube later on.  I mostly purchased this camera for still photos when on nature walks or other outside activities that may be photo-worthy.;"""
"""ÊôÆÈÄö„Å´ÂÜôÁúü„ÇíÊíÆ„Çã„ÅÆ„Å´ÂøÖË¶ÅÊúÄ‰ΩéÈôê„Å™Ê©üËÉΩ„ÇíÂÇô„Åà„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅ‰æ°Ê†º„ÇÇÊâã„Åî„Çç„Åß„ÄÅ„Å®„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇÊ∫ÄË∂≥„Åó„Å¶„Åä„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÈáçÈáè„ÅØ„Å≥„Å£„Åè„Çä„Åô„Çã„Åê„Çâ„ÅÑËªΩ„Åè„ÄÅÂàù„ÇÅ„ÅØ„É¢„ÉÉ„ÇØÔºü„Å®ÊÄù„Å£„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ„Åê„Çâ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇËªΩ„Åô„Åé„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅßÁ¥õÂ§±„Åó„Åü„Çä„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Ê∞ó„Çí„Å§„Åë„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ;"""
"""This camera fulfils an additional purpose that my cellphone cannot, and that my small wide-angle-lens 4k action camera also cannot: It has an optical zoom.I had searched the internet looking for a camera with an optical zoom, and this is the best value I found.In the end, I do not care that it can't record in 4k video, or that the picture resolution may be a little smaller than what is possible today on newer devices.I have a limited use case, where at times, I need to zoom a photo specifically to the area of the subject being photographed, and I want to do so without losing detail.This is what this camera is great for.It is not as convenient as taking out your phone quickly and taking a photo. But it ensures that when you do use it, you will likely get a more professional looking shot.Esta c√°mara cumple un prop√≥sito adicional que mi celular no puede, y que mi peque√±a c√°mara de acci√≥n 4k con lente gran angular tampoco: tiene un zoom √≥ptico.Hab√≠a buscado en Internet una c√°mara con zoom √≥ptico, y este es el mejor valor que encontr√©.Al final, no me importa que no pueda grabar en video 4k, o que la resoluci√≥n de la imagen sea un poco m√°s peque√±a de lo que es posible hoy en d√≠a en los dispositivos m√°s nuevos.Tengo un caso de uso limitado, en el que, a veces, necesito acercar una foto espec√≠ficamente al √°rea del sujeto que se est√° fotografiando, y quiero hacerlo sin perder detalles.Para eso es genial esta c√°mara.No es tan conveniente como sacar r√°pidamente el tel√©fono y tomar una foto. """If you're in the market for a high-quality point-and-shoot camera that delivers exceptional image quality, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0"" LCD is an excellent option. This camera is packed with features that make it easy to capture stunning photos and videos, whether you're a professional photographer or a hobbyist.One of the standout features of this camera is its 40x optical zoom, which is accompanied by an optical image stabilizer and zoom framing assist. This means that you can get up close and personal with your subject matter, without worrying about camera shake or blurriness. The zoom framing assist is particularly helpful, as it helps you to keep your subject centered in the frame, even when you're zooming in or out.Another great feature of the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is its ability to shoot 4K video and 4K time-lapse movies. This means that you can capture stunning footage in incredibly high resolution, which is perfect for creating high-quality videos or time-lapse sequences.In addition to its impressive video capabilities, this camera also features a 20.3 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers sharp, detailed images with accurate color reproduction. This is particularly useful when shooting in low light conditions, as the sensor is able to capture more light than other cameras in its class.Finally, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is also equipped with high-speed continuous shooting, which allows you to capture fast-moving action with ease. Whether you're photographing sports, wildlife, or other fast-paced subjects, this feature ensures that you never miss a moment.Overall, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0"" LCD is an excellent choice for anyone who wants a high-quality camera that delivers exceptional image quality, impressive video capabilities, and a range of advanced features. Highly recommended!;"""
"""So far it seems like a smart purchase for a trip of a lifetime I am taking in October!;"""
"""Most challenging picture so far has been a red bellied woodpecker(they don't stay still) in a tree across the street. Can be done Must brace camera, Zoom is ""super"". Better image quality, better lense cover, than previous Canon Powershot SX 160. But I liked the slightly larger size of the older camera, easier to hold still fit in pocket, used AA batteries. Haven't used connective features of camera, just use the cable to transfer pics. Fiddley/frail flash. Pretend its not there and you won't break it. I prefer not to manipulate pics, have not downloaded app. Can't stand the loss of privacy when sharing life history in order to access online features.;"""
"""I bought this specifically for the 40x zoom since my iPhone digital zoom is trash.This is great for wildlife encounters in daily life, and that‚Äôs it. The image quality is abysmal for selfies although there‚Äôs a flip up screen so if you are looking for a selfie cam this is not the one. If you want a selfie camera, get the NX mini from Samsung, or an RX100 series from Sony-which both sport a 1‚Äù sensor. Or get the Panasonic LX10 since that has a f1.4 which is great for portraits.I took this out just now to take photos of squirrels and it has served it‚Äôs purpose well. The weather condition was cloudy with a bit rain, but it still served well in taking photos in mediocre lighting. Note that it‚Äôs not weatherproof so always listen to the weather forecast before taking it out.Overall. This is the best compact zoom that servers the longest zoom range with a decent price point and purpose if you know what you are using it for.;"""
"""I bought this camera with the intention of taking on an upcoming trip to Italy.  I wanted something versatile enough to capture landscapes but also some occasional wildlife.  I found that the auto focus works pretty well even if you're shooting a cluttered subject like a bird in a tree.  The first photo is a basic landscape.  The color is true and the image is fairly crisp.  The second image is of a screech owl in a nesting box.  I zoomed in pretty much as far as the camera would go.  The image is not of good quality.  I was using a monopod to help stabilize the camera but that wasn't the issue.  The image is pretty badly pixilated.  The 3rd, 4th, and 5th images are of the same wall I found in the woods.  As you zoom in you can see that the sharpness goes out the window.  The last two images were taken with the lens at what I would estimate was about 300mm on a standard SLR camera.  The images turned out pretty good.  Overall I give the camera 4 stars because of it's ease of use, it's convenient small size, and photo quality between what I'd estimate is about 30mm and 300mm.  But if you're looking to use this camera for wildlife, forget it.  Trying to find active animals, such as birds, on the screen is frustrating and the image quality is just not good when you go beyond 300mm.;"""
"""Pontos a favor: praticidade, tamanho, Zoom excelente, qualidade √≥ptica superior a categoria, capacidade da bateria, recursos de menu. """If you're in the market for a high-quality point-and-shoot camera that delivers exceptional image quality, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0"" LCD is an excellent option. This camera is packed with features that make it easy to capture stunning photos and videos, whether you're a professional photographer or a hobbyist.One of the standout features of this camera is its 40x optical zoom, which is accompanied by an optical image stabilizer and zoom framing assist. This means that you can get up close and personal with your subject matter, without worrying about camera shake or blurriness. The zoom framing assist is particularly helpful, as it helps you to keep your subject centered in the frame, even when you're zooming in or out.Another great feature of the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is its ability to shoot 4K video and 4K time-lapse movies. This means that you can capture stunning footage in incredibly high resolution, which is perfect for creating high-quality videos or time-lapse sequences.In addition to its impressive video capabilities, this camera also features a 20.3 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers sharp, detailed images with accurate color reproduction. This is particularly useful when shooting in low light conditions, as the sensor is able to capture more light than other cameras in its class.Finally, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera is also equipped with high-speed continuous shooting, which allows you to capture fast-moving action with ease. Whether you're photographing sports, wildlife, or other fast-paced subjects, this feature ensures that you never miss a moment.Overall, the Canon Cameras US Point and Shoot Digital Camera with 3.0"" LCD is an excellent choice for anyone who wants a high-quality camera that delivers exceptional image quality, impressive video capabilities, and a range of advanced features. Highly recommended!;"""

"""I bought this camera with the intention of taking on an upcoming trip to Italy.  I wanted something versatile enough to capture landscapes but also some occasional wildlife.  I found that the auto focus works pretty well even if you're shooting a cluttered subject like a bird in a tree.  The first photo is a basic landscape.  The color is true and the image is fairly crisp.  The second image is of a screech owl in a nesting box.  I zoomed in pretty much as far as the camera would go.  The image is not of good quality.  I was using a monopod to help stabilize the camera but that wasn't the issue.  The image is pretty badly pixilated.  The 3rd, 4th, and 5th images are of the same wall I found in the woods.  As you zoom in you can see that the sharpness goes out the window.  The last two images were taken with the lens at what I would estimate was about 300mm on a standard SLR camera.  The images turned out pretty good.  Overall I give the camera 4 stars because of it's ease of use, it's convenient small size, and photo quality between what I'd estimate is about 30mm and 300mm.  But if you're looking to use this camera for wildlife, forget it.  Trying to find active animals, such as birds, on the screen is frustrating and the image quality is just not good when you go beyond 300mm.;"""

"""Love the 42X zoom feature. This is a great camera with one exception.  In bright sunlight the display is useless.
